Trusted or untrusted dynamic ARP inspection.
"untrusted"Untrusted dynamic ARP inspection.
"trusted"Trusted dynamic ARP inspection.
bundleoption
Enable/disable Link Aggregation Group (LAG) bundling for non-FortiLink interfaces.
"disable"Disable bundling.
"enable"Enable bundling.
descriptionstring
Description for port.
dhcp-snoop-option82-trustoption
Enable/disable allowance of DHCP with option-82 on untrusted interface.
"disable"Disable allowance of DHCP with option-82 on untrusted interface.
"enable"Enable allowance of DHCP with option-82 on untrusted interface.
dhcp-snoopingoption
Trusted or untrusted DHCP-snooping interface.
"trusted"Trusted DHCP snooping interface.
"untrusted"Untrusted DHCP snooping interface.
discard-modeoption
Configure discard mode for port.
"none"Discard disabled.
"all-untagged"Discard all frames that are untagged.
"all-tagged"Discard all frames that are tagged.
edge-portoption
Enable/disable this interface as an edge port, bridging connections between workstations and/or computers.
"disable"Disable this interface as an edge port.
"enable"Enable this interface as an edge port.
export-tagsdatasource, refer to switch-controller switch-interface-tag
Configure export tag(s) for FortiSwitch port when exported to a virtual port pool.
export-todatasource, refer to system vdom (maximum 1)
Export managed-switch port to a tenant VDOM.
export-to-pooldatasource, refer to switch-controller virtual-port-pool (maximum 1)
Switch controller export port to pool-list.
export-to-pool-flagunsigned int32
Switch controller export port to pool-list.
fgt-peer-device-namestring
fgt-peer-port-namestring
fiber-portunsigned int32
flagsunsigned int32
fortilink-portunsigned int32
igmps-flood-reportsoption
Enable/disable flooding of IGMP reports to this interface when igmp-snooping enabled.
"disable"Disable flooding of IGMP snooping reports to this interface.
"enable"Enable flooding of IGMP snooping reports to this interface.
igmps-flood-trafficoption
Enable/disable flooding of IGMP snooping traffic to this interface.
"disable"Disable flooding of IGMP snooping traffic to this interface.
"enable"Enable flooding of IGMP snooping traffic to this interface.
ip-source-guardoption
Enable/disable IP source guard.
"disable"Disable IP source guard.
"enable"Enable IP source guard.
isl-local-trunk-namestring
isl-peer-device-namestring
isl-peer-port-namestring
lacp-speedoption
end Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP) messages every 30 seconds (slow) or every second (fast).
"slow"Send LACP message every 30 seconds.
"fast"Send LACP message every second.
learning-limitunsigned int32
Limit the number of dynamic MAC addresses on this Port (1 - 128, 0 = no limit, default).
lldp-profiledatasource, refer to switch-controller lldp-profile (maximum 1)
LLDP port TLV profile.
lldp-statusoption
LLDP transmit and receive status.
"disable"Disable LLDP TX and RX.
"rx-only"Enable LLDP as RX only.
"tx-only"Enable LLDP as TX only.
"tx-rx"Enable LLDP TX and RX.
loop-guardoption
Enable/disable loop-guard on this interface, an STP optimization used to prevent network loops.
"disabled"Disable loop-guard on this interface.
"enabled"Enable loop-guard on this interface.
loop-guard-timeoutunsigned int32
Loop-guard timeout (0 - 120 min, default = 45).
mac-addrmac address
Port/Trunk MAC.
max-bundleunsigned int32
Maximum size of LAG bundle (1 - 24, default = 24)
mclagoption
Enable/disable multi-chassis link aggregation (MCLAG).
"disable"Disable MCLAG.
"enable"Enable MCLAG.
mclag-icl-portunsigned int32
member-withdrawal-behavioroption
Port behavior after it withdraws because of loss of control packets.
"forward"Forward traffic.
"block"Block traffic.
membersstring array
Aggregated LAG bundle interfaces.
min-bundleunsigned int32
Minimum size of LAG bundle (1 - 24, default = 1)
modeoption
LACP mode: ignore and do not send control messages, or negotiate 802.3ad aggregation passively or actively.
"static"Static aggregation, do not send and ignore any control messages.
"lacp-passive"Passively use LACP to negotiate 802.3ad aggregation.
"lacp-active"Actively use LACP to negotiate 802.3ad aggregation.
p2p-portunsigned int32
packet-sample-rateunsigned int32
Packet sampling rate (0 - 99999 p/sec).
packet-sampleroption
Enable/disable packet sampling on this interface.
"disabled"Disable packet sampling on this interface.
"enabled"Enable packet sampling on this interface.
poe-capableunsigned int32
PoE capable.
poe-pre-standard-detectionoption
Enable/disable PoE pre-standard detection.
"disable"Disable PoE pre-standard detection.
"enable"Enable PoE pre-standard detection.
poe-statusoption
Enable/disable PoE status.
"disable"Disable PoE status.
"enable"Enable PoE status.
port-namestring, master key
Switch port name.
port-numberunsigned int32
port-ownerstring
Switch port name.
port-prefix-typeunsigned int32
port-security-policydatasource, refer to switch-controller security-policy 802-1X (maximum 1)
Switch controller authentication policy to apply to this managed switch from available options.
port-selection-criteriaoption
Algorithm for aggregate port selection.
"src-mac"Source MAC address.
"dst-mac"Destination MAC address.
"src-dst-mac"Source and destination MAC address.
"src-ip"Source IP address.
"dst-ip"Destination IP address.
"src-dst-ip"Source and destination IP address.
ptp-policydatasource, refer to switch-controller ptp policy, or switch-controller ptp interface-policy (maximum 1)
PTP policy configuration.
qos-policydatasource, refer to switch-controller qos qos-policy (maximum 1)
Switch controller QoS policy from available options.
rpvst-portoption
Enable/disable inter-operability with rapid PVST on this interface.
"disabled"Disable inter-operability with rapid PVST on this interface.
"enabled"Enable inter-operability with rapid PVST on this interface.
sample-directionoption
Packet sampling direction.
"rx"Monitor received traffic.
"tx"Monitor transmitted traffic.
"both"Monitor transmitted and received traffic.
sflow-counter-intervalunsigned int32
sFlow sampling counter polling interval (0 - 255 sec).
speedoption
Switch port speed; default and available settings depend on hardware.
"auto"Auto-negotiation.
"10full"10M full-duplex.
"10half"10M half-duplex.
"100full"100M full-duplex.
"100half"100M half-duplex.
"1000full"1G full-duplex
"1000auto"Auto-negotiation (1G full-duplex only).
"1000fiber"1G full-duplex (fiber SFPs only)
"10000"10G full-duplex
"40000"40G full-duplex
"auto-module"Auto Module.
"100FX-half"100Mbps half-duplex.100Base-FX.
"100FX-full"100Mbps full-duplex.100Base-FX.
"100000full"100Gbps full-duplex.
"25000full"25Gbps full-duplex.
"50000full"50Gbps full-duplex.
"10000cr"10Gbps copper interface.
"10000sr"10Gbps SFI interface.
"100000sr4"100Gbps SFI interface.
"100000cr4"100Gbps copper interface.
"25000cr4"25Gbps copper interface.
"25000sr4"25Gbps SFI interface.
"5000full"5Gbps full-duplex.
"2500auto"Auto-Negotiation (2.5Gbps Only).
speed-maskunsigned int32
Switch port speed mask.
stacking-portunsigned int32
statusoption
Switch port admin status: up or down.
"down"Set admin status down.
"up"Set admin status up.
sticky-macoption
Enable or disable sticky-mac on the interface.
"disable"Disable sticky mac on the interface.
"enable"Enable sticky mac on the interface.
storm-control-policydatasource, refer to switch-controller storm-control-policy (maximum 1)
Switch controller storm control policy from available options.
stp-bpdu-guardoption
Enable/disable STP BPDU guard on this interface.
"disabled"Disable STP BPDU guard on this interface.
"enabled"Enable STP BPDU guard on this interface.
stp-bpdu-guard-timeoutunsigned int32
BPDU Guard disabling protection (0 - 120 min).
stp-root-guardoption
Enable/disable STP root guard on this interface.
"disabled"Disable STP root-guard on this interface.
"enabled"Enable STP root-guard on this interface.
stp-stateoption
Enable/disable Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) on this interface.
"disabled"Disable STP on this interface.
"enabled"Enable STP on this interface.
switch-idstring
typeoption
Interface type: physical or trunk port.
"physical"Physical port.
"trunk"Trunk port.
untagged-vlansdatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan
Configure switch port untagged vlans
virtual-portunsigned int32
Virtualized switch port.
vlandatasource, refer to switch-controller vlan, system interface, or fsp vlan (maximum 1)
Assign switch ports to a VLAN.

 

switch-controller/managed-switch/remote-log (table)

Configure logging by FortiSwitch device to a remote syslog server.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/remote-log
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/remote-log/<remote-log_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
csvoption
Enable/disable comma-separated value (CSV) strings.
"disable"Disable comma-separated value (CSV) strings.
"enable"Enable comma-separated value (CSV) strings.
facilityoption
Facility to log to remote syslog server.
"kernel"Kernel messages.
"user"Random user-level messages.
"mail"Mail system.
"daemon"System daemons.
"auth"Security/authorization messages.
"syslog"Messages generated internally by syslogd.
"lpr"Line printer subsystem.
"news"Network news subsystem.
"uucp"UUCP server messages.
"cron"Clock daemon.
"authpriv"Security/authorization messages (private).
"ftp"FTP daemon.
"ntp"NTP daemon.
"audit"Log audit.
"alert"Log alert.
"clock"Clock daemon.
"local0"Reserved for local use.
"local1"Reserved for local use.
"local2"Reserved for local use.
"local3"Reserved for local use.
"local4"Reserved for local use.
"local5"Reserved for local use.
"local6"Reserved for local use.
"local7"Reserved for local use.
namestring, master key
Remote log name.
portunsigned int32
Remote syslog server listening port.
serverstring
IPv4 address of the remote syslog server.
severityoption
Severity of logs to be transferred to remote log server.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
statusoption
Enable/disable logging by FortiSwitch device to a remote syslog server.
"disable"Disable logging by FortiSwitch device to a remote syslog server.
"enable"Enable logging by FortiSwitch device to a remote syslog server.

 

switch-controller/managed-switch/snmp-community (table)

Configuration method to edit Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) communities.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/snmp-community
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/snmp-community/<snmp-community_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
eventsflags
SNMP notifications (traps) to send.
"cpu-high"Send a trap when CPU usage too high.
"mem-low"Send a trap when available memory is low.
"log-full"Send a trap when log disk space becomes low.
"intf-ip"Send a trap when an interface IP address is changed.
"ent-conf-change"Send a trap when an entity MIB change occurs (RFC4133).
hoststable
idsequence, master key
SNMP community ID.
namestring
SNMP community name.
query-v1-portunsigned int32
SNMP v1 query port (default = 161).
query-v1-statusoption
Enable/disable SNMP v1 queries.
"disable"Disable SNMP v1 queries.
"enable"Enable SNMP v1 queries.
query-v2c-portunsigned int32
SNMP v2c query port (default = 161).
query-v2c-statusoption
Enable/disable SNMP v2c queries.
"disable"Disable SNMP v2c queries.
"enable"Enable SNMP v2c queries.
statusoption
Enable/disable this SNMP community.
"disable"Disable SNMP community.
"enable"Enable SNMP community.
trap-v1-lportunsigned int32
SNMP v2c trap local port (default = 162).
trap-v1-rportunsigned int32
SNMP v2c trap remote port (default = 162).
trap-v1-statusoption
Enable/disable SNMP v1 traps.
"disable"Disable SNMP v1 traps.
"enable"Enable SNMP v1 traps.
trap-v2c-lportunsigned int32
SNMP v2c trap local port (default = 162).
trap-v2c-rportunsigned int32
SNMP v2c trap remote port (default = 162).
trap-v2c-statusoption
Enable/disable SNMP v2c traps.
"disable"Disable SNMP v2c traps.
"enable"Enable SNMP v2c traps.

"md5"HMAC-MD5-96 authentication protocol.
"sha"HMAC-SHA-96 authentication protocol.

Password for authentication protocol.

SNMP user name.

Privacy (encryption) protocol.
"des"CBC-DES symmetric encryption protocol.
"aes"CFB128-AES-128 symmetric encryption protocol.

Password for privacy (encryption) protocol.

"enable"Enable SNMP queries for this user.

"no-auth-no-priv"Message with no authentication and no privacy (encryption).
"auth-no-priv"Message with authentication but no privacy (encryption).
"auth-priv"Message with authentication and privacy (encryption).

switch-controller/managed-switch/storm-control (object)

Configuration method to edit FortiSwitch storm control for measuring traffic activity using data rates to prevent traffic disruption.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/storm-control
Attribute ListDescriptions
broadcastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop broadcast traffic.
"disable"Allow broadcast traffic.
"enable"Drop broadcast traffic.
local-overrideoption
Enable to override global FortiSwitch storm control settings for this FortiSwitch.
"disable"Use global storm control settings.
"enable"Override global storm control settings.
rateunsigned int32
Rate in packets per second at which storm traffic is controlled (1 - 10000000, default = 500). Storm control drops excess traffic data rates beyond this threshold.
unknown-multicastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop unknown multicast traffic.
"disable"Allow unknown multicast traffic.
"enable"Drop unknown multicast traffic.
unknown-unicastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop unknown unicast traffic.
"disable"Allow unknown unicast traffic.
"enable"Drop unknown unicast traffic.

switch-controller/managed-switch/stp-settings (object)

Configuration method to edit Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) settings used to prevent bridge loops.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/stp-settings
Attribute ListDescriptions
forward-timeunsigned int32
Period of time a port is in listening and learning state (4 - 30 sec, default = 15).
hello-timeunsigned int32
Period of time between successive STP frame Bridge Protocol Data Units (BPDUs) sent on a port (1 - 10 sec, default = 2).
local-overrideoption
Enable to configure local STP settings that override global STP settings.
"disable"Use global STP settings.
"enable"Override global STP settings.
max-ageunsigned int32
Maximum time before a bridge port saves its configuration BPDU information (6 - 40 sec, default = 20).
max-hopsunsigned int32
Maximum number of hops between the root bridge and the furthest bridge (1- 40, default = 20).
namestring
Name of local STP settings configuration.
pending-timerunsigned int32
Pending time (1 - 15 sec, default = 4).
revisionunsigned int32
STP revision number (0 - 65535).
statusoption
Enable/disable STP.
"disable"Disable STP.
"enable"Enable STP.

Configuration method to edit FortiSwitch logging settings (logs are transferred to and inserted into the FortiGate event log).

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/managed-switch/<managed-switch_switch-id>/switch-log
Attribute ListDescriptions
local-overrideoption
Enable to configure local logging settings that override global logging settings.
"disable"Use global logging settings.
"enable"Override global logging settings.
severityoption
Severity of FortiSwitch logs that are added to the FortiGate event log.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
statusoption
Enable/disable adding FortiSwitch logs to the FortiGate event log.
"disable"Do not add FortiSwitch logs to the FortiGate event log.
"enable"Add FortiSwitch logs to the FortiGate event log.

 

switch-controller/nac-device (table)

Configure/list NAC devices learned on the managed FortiSwitch ports which matches NAC policy.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/nac-device
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/nac-device/<nac-device_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
descriptionstring
Description for the learned NAC device.
entry-idunsigned int32
FSW entry id for the NAC device.
idsequence, master key
Device ID.
last-known-portstring
Managed FortiSwitch port where NAC device is last learned.
last-known-switchdatasource, refer to switch-controller managed-switch (maximum 1)
Managed FortiSwitch where NAC device is last learned.
last-seenunsigned int32
macmac address
MAC address of the learned NAC device.
mac-policydatasource, refer to switch-controller mac-policy (maximum 1)
MAC policy to be applied on this learned NAC device.
matched-nac-policydatasource, refer to user nac-policy (maximum 1)
Matched NAC policy for the learned NAC device.
port-policydatasource, refer to switch-controller port-policy (maximum 1)
Port policy to be applied on this learned NAC device.
statusoption
Status of the learned NAC device. Set enable to authorize the NAC device.
"disable"Disable the NAC device.
"enable"Enable the NAC device.

 

switch-controller/nac-settings (table)

Configure integrated NAC settings for FortiSwitch.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/nac-settings
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/nac-settings/<nac-settings_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
auto-authoption
Enable/disable NAC device auto authorization when discovered and nac-policy matched.
"disable"Disable NAC device auto authorization.
"enable"Enable NAC device auto authorization.
bounce-nac-portoption
Enable/disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port when NAC mode is configured on the port. Helps to re-initiate the DHCP process for a device.
"disable"Disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port when NAC mode is configured.
"enable"Enable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port when NAC mode is configured.
inactive-timerunsigned int32
Time interval(minutes, 0 = no expiry) to be included in the inactive NAC devices expiry calculation (mac age-out + inactive-time + periodic scan interval).
link-down-flushoption
Clear NAC devices on switch ports on link down event.
"disable"Disable clearing NAC devices on a switch port when link down event happens.
"enable"Enable clearing NAC devices on a switch port when link down event happens.
modeoption
Set NAC mode to be used on the FortiSwitch ports.
"local"Local mode in which managed FortiSwitch port local settings is used.
"global"Global mode which enables NAC on all the managed FortiSwitch ports.
namestring, master key
NAC settings name.
onboarding-vlandatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Default NAC Onboarding VLAN when NAC devices are discovered.

"disable"Disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where this port policy is applied.
"enable"Enable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where this port policy is applied.

"disable"Disable egress priority tagging.
"enable"Enable egress priority tagging.

priority-0option

"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).

"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).

"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).
priority-3option
COS queue mapped to dot1p priority number.
"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).
priority-4option
COS queue mapped to dot1p priority number.
"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).
priority-5option
COS queue mapped to dot1p priority number.
"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).
priority-6option
COS queue mapped to dot1p priority number.
"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).
priority-7option
COS queue mapped to dot1p priority number.
"queue-0"COS queue 0 (lowest priority).
"queue-1"COS queue 1.
"queue-2"COS queue 2.
"queue-3"COS queue 3.
"queue-4"COS queue 4.
"queue-5"COS queue 5.
"queue-6"COS queue 6.
"queue-7"COS queue 7 (highest priority).

weightunsigned int32

"information"Information level.

switch-controller/security-policy/802-1X (table)

Configure 802.1x MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) policies.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/security-policy/802-1X
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/security-policy/802-1X/<802-1X_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
auth-fail-vlanoption
Enable to allow limited access to clients that cannot authenticate.
"disable"Disable authentication fail VLAN on this interface.
"enable"Enable authentication fail VLAN on this interface.
auth-fail-vlan-iddatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan (maximum 1)
VLAN ID on which authentication failed.
auth-fail-vlanidunsigned int32
VLAN ID on which authentication failed.
eap-auto-untagged-vlansoption
Enable/disable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.
"disable"Disable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.
"enable"Enable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.
eap-passthruoption
Enable/disable EAP pass-through mode, allowing protocols (such as LLDP) to pass through ports for more flexible authentication.
"disable"Disable EAP pass-through mode on this interface.
"enable"Enable EAP pass-through mode on this interface.
framevid-applyoption
Enable/disable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.
"disable"Disable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.
"enable"Enable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.
guest-auth-delayunsigned int32
Guest authentication delay (1 - 900 sec, default = 30).
guest-vlanoption
Enable the guest VLAN feature to allow limited access to non-802.1X-compliant clients.
"disable"Disable guest VLAN on this interface.
"enable"Enable guest VLAN on this interface.
guest-vlan-iddatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan (maximum 1)
Guest VLAN name.
guest-vlanidunsigned int32
Guest VLAN ID.
mac-auth-bypassoption
Enable/disable MAB for this policy.
"disable"Disable MAB.
"enable"Enable MAB.
namestring, master key
Policy name.
open-authoption
Enable/disable open authentication for this policy.
"disable"Disable open authentication.
"enable"Enable open authentication.
policy-typeoption
Policy type.
"802.1X"802.1X security policy.
radius-timeout-overwriteoption
Enable to override the global RADIUS session timeout.
"disable"Override the global RADIUS session timeout.
"enable"Use the global RADIUS session timeout.
security-modeoption
Port or MAC based 802.1X security mode.
"802.1X"802.1X port based authentication.
"802.1X-mac-based"802.1X MAC based authentication.
user-groupdatasource, refer to user group
Name of user-group to assign to this MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) policy.

Attribute ListDescriptions
eventsflags
SNMP notifications (traps) to send.
"cpu-high"Send a trap when CPU usage too high.
"mem-low"Send a trap when available memory is low.
"log-full"Send a trap when log disk space becomes low.
"intf-ip"Send a trap when an interface IP address is changed.
"ent-conf-change"Send a trap when an entity MIB change occurs (RFC4133).

idsequence, master key

"enable"Enable SNMP v2c queries.
statusoption
Enable/disable this SNMP community.
"disable"Disable SNMP community.
"enable"Enable SNMP community.

trap-v1-rportunsigned int32

"disable"Disable SNMP v1 traps.
"enable"Enable SNMP v1 traps.

switch-controller/storm-control (object)

Configure FortiSwitch storm control.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/storm-control
Attribute ListDescriptions
broadcastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop broadcast traffic.
"disable"Disable broadcast storm control.
"enable"Enable broadcast storm control.
rateunsigned int32
Rate in packets per second at which storm traffic is controlled (1 - 10000000, default = 500). Storm control drops excess traffic data rates beyond this threshold.
unknown-multicastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop unknown multicast traffic.
"disable"Disable unknown multicast storm control.
"enable"Enable unknown multicast storm control.
unknown-unicastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop unknown unicast traffic.
"disable"Disable unknown unicast storm control.
"enable"Enable unknown unicast storm control.

 

switch-controller/storm-control-policy (table)

Configure FortiSwitch storm control policy to be applied on managed-switch ports.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/storm-control-policy
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/storm-control-policy/<storm-control-policy_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
broadcastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow broadcast traffic in override mode.
"disable"Disable storm control for broadcast traffic to allow all packets.
"enable"Enable storm control for broadcast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.
descriptionstring
Description of the storm control policy.
namestring, master key
Storm control policy name.
rateunsigned int32
Threshold rate in packets per second at which storm traffic is controlled in override mode (default=500, 0 to drop all).
storm-control-modeoption
Set Storm control mode.
"disabled"Disable storm control on the port entirely overriding global and switch level storm control.
"global"Apply Global or switch level storm control configuration.
"override"Override global and switch level storm control to use port level configuration.
unknown-multicastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow unknown multicast traffic in override mode.
"disable"Disable storm control for unknown multicast traffic to allow all packets.
"enable"Enable storm control for unknown multicast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.
unknown-unicastoption
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow unknown unicast traffic in override mode.
"disable"Disable storm control for unknown unicast traffic to allow all packets.
"enable"Enable storm control for unknown unicast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.

switch-controller/stp-settings (object)

Configure FortiSwitch spanning tree protocol (STP).

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/stp-settings
Attribute ListDescriptions
forward-timeunsigned int32
Period of time a port is in listening and learning state (4 - 30 sec, default = 15).
hello-timeunsigned int32
Period of time between successive STP frame Bridge Protocol Data Units (BPDUs) sent on a port (1 - 10 sec, default = 2).
max-ageunsigned int32
Maximum time before a bridge port saves its configuration BPDU information (6 - 40 sec, default = 20).
max-hopsunsigned int32
Maximum number of hops between the root bridge and the furthest bridge (1- 40, default = 20).
namestring
Name of global STP settings configuration.
pending-timerunsigned int32
Pending time (1 - 15 sec, default = 4).
revisionunsigned int32
STP revision number (0 - 65535).
statusoption
Enable/disable STP.
"disable"Disable STP.
"enable"Enable STP.

"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.

"disable"Do not add FortiSwitch logs to FortiGate event log.
"enable"Add FortiSwitch logs to FortiGate event log.

switch-controller/system (object)

Configure system-wide switch controller settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/switch-controller/system
Attribute ListDescriptions
data-sync-intervalunsigned int32
Time interval between collection of switch data (30 - 1800 sec, default = 60, 0 = disable).
iot-holdoffunsigned int32
MAC entry's creation time. Time must be greater than this value for an entry to be created (0 - 10080 mins, default = 5 mins).
iot-mac-idleunsigned int32
MAC entry's idle time. MAC entry is removed after this value (0 - 10080 mins, default = 1440 mins).
iot-scan-intervalunsigned int32
IoT scan interval (2 - 10080 mins, default = 60 mins, 0 = disable).
iot-weight-thresholdunsigned int32
MAC entry's confidence value. Value is re-queried when below this value (default = 1, 0 = disable).
parallel-processunsigned int32
Maximum number of parallel processes.
parallel-process-overrideoption
Enable/disable parallel process override.
"disable"Disable maximum parallel process override.
"enable"Enable maximum parallel process override.

 

switch-controller/traffic-policy (table)

Configure FortiSwitch traffic policy.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/traffic-policy
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/traffic-policy/<traffic-policy_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
cos-queueunsigned int32
COS queue(0 - 7), or unset to disable.
descriptionstring
Description of the traffic policy.
guaranteed-bandwidthunsigned int32
Guaranteed bandwidth in kbps (max value = 524287000).
guaranteed-burstunsigned int32
Guaranteed burst size in bytes (max value = 4294967295).
idunsigned int32
FSW Policer id
maximum-burstunsigned int32
Maximum burst size in bytes (max value = 4294967295).
namestring, master key
Traffic policy name.
policer-statusoption
Enable/disable policer config on the traffic policy.
"disable"Disable policer config on the traffic policy.
"enable"Enable policer config on the traffic policy.
typeoption
"ingress"
"egress"

 

switch-controller/traffic-sniffer (object)

Configure FortiSwitch RSPAN/ERSPAN traffic sniffing parameters.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/traffic-sniffer
Attribute ListDescriptions
erspan-ipIPv4 address
Configure ERSPAN collector IP address.
modeoption
Configure traffic sniffer mode.
"none"Disable traffic mirroring (sniffer).
"erspan-auto"Mirror traffic using a GRE tunnel.
"rspan"Mirror traffic on a layer2 VLAN.
target-iptable
target-mactable
target-porttable

switch-controller/vlan-policy (table)

Configure VLAN policy to be applied on the managed FortiSwitch ports through port-policy.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/vlan-policy
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/switch-controller/vlan-policy/<vlan-policy_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
allowed-vlansdatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan
Allowed VLANs to be applied when using this VLAN policy.
allowed-vlans-alloption
Enable/disable all defined VLANs when using this VLAN policy.
"disable"Disable all defined VLANs.
"enable"Enable all defined VLANs.
descriptionstring
Description for the VLAN policy.
discard-modeoption
Discard mode to be applied when using this VLAN policy.
"none"Discard disabled.
"all-untagged"Discard all frames that are untagged.
"all-tagged"Discard all frames that are tagged.
fortilinkdatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
FortiLink interface for which this VLAN policy belongs to.
namestring, master key
VLAN policy name.
untagged-vlansdatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan
Untagged VLANs to be applied when using this VLAN policy.
vlandatasource, refer to system interface, or fsp vlan (maximum 1)
Native VLAN to be applied when using this VLAN policy.

ID.
init-stringstring
Init string in hexadecimal format (even length).

MODEM model name.
modeswitch-stringstring
USB modeswitch arguments. e.g: '-v 1410 -p 9030 -V 1410 -P 9032 -u 3'
product-idstring

vendorstring

vendor-idstring

"enable"Enable overriding the global administrator idle timeout.

Object URL:

Attribute ListDescriptions
accprofiledatasource, refer to system accprofile (maximum 1)
Access profile for this administrator. Access profiles control administrator access to FortiGate features.
accprofile-overrideoption
Enable to use the name of an access profile provided by the remote authentication server to control the FortiGate features that this administrator can access.
"disable"Disable access profile override.
"enable"Enable access profile override.

Enable/disable allow admin session to be removed by privileged admin users.
"disable"Disable allow-remove option.
"enable"Enable allow-remove option.

Comment.

"disable"Disable force password change on next login.
"enable"Enable force password change on next login.

"disable"Disable guest authentication.
"enable"Enable guest authentication.

history1password

Set to enable peer certificate authentication (for HTTPS admin access).
"disable"Disable peer.
"enable"Enable peer.
peer-groupdatasource, refer to user group (maximum 1)
Name of peer group defined under config user group which has PKI members. Used for peer certificate authentication (for HTTPS admin access).

"disable"Disable VDOM override.
"enable"Enable VDOM override.

Enable/disable authentication using a remote RADIUS, LDAP, or TACACS+ server.
"disable"Disable remote authentication.
"enable"Enable remote authentication.
remote-groupdatasource, refer to user group (maximum 1)
User group name used for remote auth.
schedulestring
Firewall schedule used to restrict when the administrator can log in. No schedule means no restrictions.
sms-custom-serverdatasource, refer to system sms-server (maximum 1)
Custom SMS server to send SMS messages to.
sms-phonestring
Phone number on which the administrator receives SMS messages.
sms-serveroption
Send SMS messages using the FortiGuard SMS server or a custom server.
"fortiguard"Send SMS by FortiGuard.
"custom"Send SMS by custom server.
ssh-certificatedatasource, refer to certificate local, certificate remote, vpn certificate local, or vpn certificate remote (maximum 1)
Select the certificate to be used by the FortiGate for authentication with an SSH client.
ssh-public-key1string
Public key of an SSH client. The client is authenticated without being asked for credentials. Create the public-private key pair in the SSH client application.
ssh-public-key2string
Public key of an SSH client. The client is authenticated without being asked for credentials. Create the public-private key pair in the SSH client application.
ssh-public-key3string
Public key of an SSH client. The client is authenticated without being asked for credentials. Create the public-private key pair in the SSH client application.
trusthost1IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost10IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost2IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost3IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost4IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost5IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost6IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost7IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost8IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost9IPv4 address/mask
Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
two-factoroption
Enable/disable two-factor authentication.
"disable"Disable two-factor authentication.
"fortitoken"Use FortiToken or FortiToken mobile two-factor authentication.
"email"Send a two-factor authentication code to the configured email-to email address.
"sms"Send a two-factor authentication code to the configured sms-server and sms-phone.
"fortitoken-cloud"FortiToken Cloud Service.
two-factor-authenticationoption
Authentication method by FortiToken Cloud.
"fortitoken"FortiToken authentication.
"email"Email one time password.
"sms"SMS one time password.
two-factor-notificationoption
Notification method for user activation by FortiToken Cloud.
"email"Email notification for activation code.
"sms"SMS notification for activation code.
vdomdatasource, refer to system vdom
Virtual domain(s) that the administrator can access.
wildcardoption
Enable/disable wildcard RADIUS authentication.
"disable"Disable username wildcard.
"enable"Enable username wildcard.

Number of megabytes to limit script output to (10 - 1024, default = 10).
repeatunsigned int32
Number of times to repeat this script (0 = infinite).
scriptstring
List of FortiOS CLI commands to repeat.
startoption
Script starting mode.
"auto"Starting automatically.
"manual"Starting manually.
timeoutunsigned int32
Maximum running time for this script in seconds (0 = no timeout).

"cli-script"Run CLI script.
"google-cloud-function"Send log data to a Google Cloud function.

"delete"DELETE.
"get"GET.
"post"POST.
"put"PUT.
"patch"PATCH.

"https"HTTPS.

"enable"Required in action chain.

tls-certificatedatasource, refer to certificate local, or vpn certificate local (maximum 1)

uristring

system/central-management (object)

Configure central management.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/central-management
Attribute ListDescriptions
allow-monitoroption
Enable/disable allowing the central management server to remotely monitor this FortiGate
"disable"Disable remote monitoring of device.
"enable"Enable remote monitoring of device.
allow-push-configurationoption
Enable/disable allowing the central management server to push configuration changes to this FortiGate.
"disable"Disable push configuration.
"enable"Enable push configuration.
allow-push-firmwareoption
Enable/disable allowing the central management server to push firmware updates to this FortiGate.
"disable"Disable push firmware.
"enable"Enable push firmware.
allow-remote-firmware-upgradeoption
Enable/disable remotely upgrading the firmware on this FortiGate from the central management server.
"disable"Disable remote firmware upgrade.
"enable"Enable remote firmware upgrade.
allow-remote-lte-firmware-upgradeoption
Enable/disable remotely upgrading the lte firmware on this FortiGate from the central management server.
"disable"Disable remote lte firmware upgrade.
"enable"Enable remote lte firmware upgrade.
ca-certstring
CA certificate to be used by FGFM protocol.
enc-algorithmoption
Encryption strength for communications between the FortiGate and central management.
"default"High strength algorithms and these medium-strength 128-bit key length algorithms: RC4-SHA, RC4-MD5, RC4-MD.
"high"128-bit and larger key length algorithms: DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA, AES256-SHA, EDH-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA, DES-CBC3-SHA, DES-CBC3-MD5, DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA, AES128-SHA.
"low"64-bit or 56-bit key length algorithms without export restrictions: EDH-RSA-DES-CDBC-SHA, DES-CBC-SHA, DES-CBC-MD5.
fmgstring array
IP address or FQDN of the FortiManager.
fmg-source-ipIPv4 address
IPv4 source address that this FortiGate uses when communicating with FortiManager.
fmg-source-ip6IPv6 address
IPv6 source address that this FortiGate uses when communicating with FortiManager.
fmg-update-portoption
Port used to communicate with FortiManager that is acting as a FortiGuard update server.
"443"Use port 443 to communicate with FortiManager that is acting as a FortiGuard update server.
"8890"Use port 8890 to communicate with FortiManager that is acting as a FortiGuard update server.
include-default-serversoption
Enable/disable inclusion of public FortiGuard servers in the override server list.
"disable"Disable inclusion of public FortiGuard servers in the override server list.
"enable"Enable inclusion of public FortiGuard servers in the override server list.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Specify outgoing interface to reach server.
interface-select-methodoption
Specify how to select outgoing interface to reach server.
"auto"Set outgoing interface automatically.
"sdwan"Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules.
"specify"Set outgoing interface manually.
local-certstring
Certificate to be used by FGFM protocol.
ltefw-upgrade-frequencyoption
Set LTE firmware auto pushdown frequency.
"everyHour"Auto check and pushdown LTE firmware every hour
"every12hour"Auto check and pushdown LTE firmware every 12 hours
"everyDay"Auto check and pushdown LTE firmware every day
"everyWeek"Auto check and pushdown LTE firmware every week
ltefw-upgrade-timestring
Schedule next LTE firmware upgrade time (Local Time). Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
modeoption
Central management mode.
"normal"Manage and configure this FortiGate from FortiManager.
"backup"Manage and configure this FortiGate locally and back up its configuration to FortiManager.
schedule-config-restoreoption
Enable/disable allowing the central management server to restore the configuration of this FortiGate.
"disable"Disable scheduled configuration restore.
"enable"Enable scheduled configuration restore.
schedule-script-restoreoption
Enable/disable allowing the central management server to restore the scripts stored on this FortiGate.
"disable"Disable scheduled script restore.
"enable"Enable scheduled script restore.
serial-numberstring array
Serial number.
server-listtable
typeoption
Central management type.
"fortimanager"FortiManager.
"fortiguard"Central management of this FortiGate using FortiCloud.
"none"No central management.
use-elbc-vdomoption
Enable/disable use of special ELBC config sync VDOM to connect to FortiManager.
"disable"
"enable"
vdomdatasource, refer to system vdom (maximum 1)
Virtual domain (VDOM) name to use when communicating with FortiManager.

system/cluster-sync (table)

Configure FortiGate Session Life Support Protocol (FGSP) session synchronization.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/cluster-sync
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/cluster-sync/<cluster-sync_sync-id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
down-intfs-before-sess-syncdatasource, refer to system interface
List of interfaces to be turned down before session synchronization is complete.
hb-intervalunsigned int32
Heartbeat interval (1 - 20 (100*ms). Increase to reduce false positives.
hb-lost-thresholdunsigned int32
Lost heartbeat threshold (1 - 60). Increase to reduce false positives.
ipsec-tunnel-syncoption
Enable/disable IPsec tunnel synchronization.
"disable"Disable IPsec tunnel synchronization.
"enable"Enable IPsec tunnel synchronization.
peeripIPv4 address
IP address of the interface on the peer unit that is used for the session synchronization link.
peervddatasource, refer to system vdom (maximum 1)
VDOM that contains the session synchronization link interface on the peer unit. Usually both peers would have the same peervd.
session-sync-filterobject
slave-add-ike-routesoption
Enable/disable IKE route announcement on the backup unit.
"disable"Do not add IKE routes to the backup unit.
"enable"Add IKE routes to the backup unit.
sync-idsequence, master key
Sync ID.
syncvddatasource, refer to system vdom
Sessions from these VDOMs are synchronized using this session synchronization configuration.

 

system/cluster-sync/session-sync-filter (object)

Add one or more filters if you only want to synchronize some sessions. Use the filter to configure the types of sessions to synchronize.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/cluster-sync/<cluster-sync_sync-id>/session-sync-filter
Attribute ListDescriptions
custom-servicetable
dstaddrIPv4 address/mask
Only sessions to this IPv4 address are synchronized. You can only enter one address. To synchronize sessions for multiple destination addresses, add multiple filters.
dstaddr6IPv6 prefix
Only sessions to this IPv6 address are synchronized. You can only enter one address. To synchronize sessions for multiple destination addresses, add multiple filters.
dstintfdatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Only sessions to this interface are synchronized. You can only enter one interface name. To synchronize sessions to multiple destination interfaces, add multiple filters.
srcaddrIPv4 address/mask
Only sessions from this IPv4 address are synchronized. You can only enter one address. To synchronize sessions from multiple source addresses, add multiple filters.
srcaddr6IPv6 prefix
Only sessions from this IPv6 address are synchronized. You can only enter one address. To synchronize sessions from multiple source addresses, add multiple filters.
srcintfdatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Only sessions from this interface are synchronized. You can only enter one interface name. To synchronize sessions for multiple source interfaces, add multiple filters.

 

system/cluster-sync/session-sync-filter/custom-service (table)

Only sessions using these custom services are synchronized. Use source and destination port ranges to define these custome services.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/cluster-sync/<cluster-sync_sync-id>/session-sync-filter/custom-service
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/cluster-sync/<cluster-sync_sync-id>/session-sync-filter/custom-service/<custom-service_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
dst-port-rangestring
Custom service destination port range.
idsequence, master key
Custom service ID.
src-port-rangestring
Custom service source port range.

system/csf (object)

Add this FortiGate to a Security Fabric or set up a new Security Fabric on this FortiGate.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/csf
Attribute ListDescriptions
accept-auth-by-certoption
Accept connections with unknown certificates and ask admin for approval.
"disable"Do not accept SSL connections with unknown certificates.
"enable"Accept SSL connections without automatic certificate verification.
authorization-request-typeoption
Authorization request type.
"certificate"Request verification by certificate.
"serial"Request verification by serial number.
certificatedatasource, refer to certificate local, or vpn certificate local (maximum 1)
Certificate.
configuration-syncoption
Configuration sync mode.
"default"Synchronize configuration for FortiAnalyzer, FortiSandbox, and Central Management to root node.
"local"Do not synchronize configuration with root node.
fabric-devicetable
fabric-object-unificationoption
Fabric CMDB Object Unification.
"default"Global CMDB objects will be synchronized in Security Fabric.
"local"Global CMDB objects will not be synchronized to and from this device.
fixed-keypassword
Auto-generated fixed key used when this device is the root. (Will automatically be generated if not set.)
group-namestring
Security Fabric group name. All FortiGates in a Security Fabric must have the same group name.
group-passwordpassword
Security Fabric group password. All FortiGates in a Security Fabric must have the same group password.
management-ipstring
Management IP address of this FortiGate. Used to log into this FortiGate from another FortiGate in the Security Fabric.
management-portunsigned int32
Overriding port for management connection (Overrides admin port).
saml-configuration-syncoption
SAML setting configuration synchronization.
"default"SAML setting for fabric members is created by fabric root.
"local"Do not apply SAML configuration generated by root.
statusoption
Enable/disable Security Fabric.
"disable"Disable Security Fabric.
"enable"Enable Security Fabric.
trusted-listtable
upstream-ipIPv4 address
IP address of the FortiGate upstream from this FortiGate in the Security Fabric.
upstream-portunsigned int32
The port number to use to communicate with the FortiGate upstream from this FortiGate in the Security Fabric (default = 8013).

system/ddns (table)

Object URL:

Attribute ListDescriptions
bound-ipIPv4 address
clear-textoption
Enable/disable use of clear text connections.
"disable"Disable use of clear text connections.
"enable"Enable use of clear text connections.
ddns-authoption
Enable/disable TSIG authentication for your DDNS server.
"disable"Disable DDNS authentication.
"tsig"Enable TSIG authentication based on RFC2845.
ddns-domainstring
Your fully qualified domain name (for example, yourname.DDNS.com).
ddns-keypassword
DDNS update key (base 64 encoding).
ddns-keynamestring
DDNS update key name.
ddns-passwordpassword
DDNS password.
ddns-serveroption

"dhs.org"members.dhs.org
"dyndns.org"members.dyndns.org and dnsalias.com
"dyns.net"www.dyns.net
"tzo.com"rh.tzo.com
"vavic.com"Peanut Hull
"now.net.cn"ip.todayisp.com
"dipdns.net"dipdnsserver.dipdns.com
"easydns.com"members.easydns.com
"genericDDNS"Generic DDNS based on RFC2136.
"FortiGuardDDNS"FortiGuard DDNS service.
"noip.com"dynupdate.no-ip.com
ddns-server-ipIPv4 address
ddns-snstring
DDNS Serial Number.
ddns-ttlunsigned int32
Time-to-live for DDNS packets.
ddns-usernamestring
DDNS user name.
ddns-zonestring
Zone of your domain name (for example, DDNS.com).
ddnsidsequence, master key
DDNS ID.
monitor-interfacedatasource, refer to system interface
Monitored interface.
ssl-certificatedatasource, refer to certificate local, or vpn certificate local (maximum 1)
Name of local certificate for SSL connections.
update-intervalunsigned int32
DDNS update interval (60 - 2592000 sec, default = 300).
use-public-ipoption
Enable/disable use of public IP address.
"disable"Disable use of public IP address.
"enable"Enable use of public IP address.

statusoption

"enable"Enable setting.

Attribute ListDescriptions
dns-search-listoption
DNS search list options.
"specify"Specify the DNS search list.
"delegated"Delegated the DNS search list.
dns-server1IPv6 address
DNS server 1.
dns-server2IPv6 address
DNS server 2.
dns-server3IPv6 address
DNS server 3.
dns-server4IPv6 address
DNS server 4.
dns-serviceoption
Options for assigning DNS servers to DHCPv6 clients.
"default"Clients are assigned the FortiGate's configured DNS servers.
"specify"Specify up to 3 DNS servers in the DHCPv6 server configuration.
"delegated"Delegated DNS settings.
domainstring
Domain name suffix for the IP addresses that the DHCP server assigns to clients.
idsequence, master key
ID.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
DHCP server can assign IP configurations to clients connected to this interface.
ip-modeoption
Method used to assign client IP.
"range"Use range defined by start IP/end IP to assign client IP.
"delegated"Use delegated prefix method to assign client IP.
ip-rangetable
lease-timeunsigned int32
Lease time in seconds, 0 means unlimited.
option1string
Option 1.
option2string
Option 2.
option3string
Option 3.
prefix-rangetable
rapid-commitoption
Enable/disable allow/disallow rapid commit.
"disable"Do not allow rapid commit.
"enable"Allow rapid commit.
statusoption
Enable/disable this DHCPv6 configuration.
"disable"Enable this DHCPv6 server configuration.
"enable"Disable this DHCPv6 server configuration.
subnetIPv6 prefix
Subnet or subnet-id if the IP mode is delegated.
upstream-interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Interface name from where delegated information is provided.

system/dns (object)

Configure DNS.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/dns
Attribute ListDescriptions
cache-notfound-responsesoption
Enable/disable response from the DNS server when a record is not in cache.
"disable"Disable cache NOTFOUND responses from DNS server.
"enable"Enable cache NOTFOUND responses from DNS server.
dns-cache-limitunsigned int32
Maximum number of records in the DNS cache.
dns-cache-ttlunsigned int32
Duration in seconds that the DNS cache retains information.
dns-over-tlsoption
Enable/disable/enforce DNS over TLS.
"disable"Disable DNS over TLS.
"enable"Use TLS for DNS queries if TLS is available.
"enforce"Use only TLS for DNS queries. Does not fall back to unencrypted DNS queries if TLS is unavailable.
domainstring array
Search suffix list for hostname lookup.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Specify outgoing interface to reach server.
interface-select-methodoption
Specify how to select outgoing interface to reach server.
"auto"Set outgoing interface automatically.
"sdwan"Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules.
"specify"Set outgoing interface manually.
ip6-primaryIPv6 address
Primary DNS server IPv6 address.
ip6-secondaryIPv6 address
Secondary DNS server IPv6 address.
primaryIPv4 address
Primary DNS server IP address.
retryunsigned int32
Number of times to retry (0 - 5).
secondaryIPv4 address
Secondary DNS server IP address.
server-hostnamestring array
DNS server host name list.
source-ipIPv4 address
IP address used by the DNS server as its source IP.
ssl-certificatedatasource, refer to certificate local, vpn certificate local, or dynamic certificate local (maximum 1)
Name of local certificate for SSL connections.
timeoutunsigned int32
DNS query timeout interval in seconds (1 - 10).

 

system/dns-database (table)

Configure DNS databases.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/dns-database
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/dns-database/<dns-database_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
allow-transferIPv4 address array
DNS zone transfer IP address list.
authoritativeoption
Enable/disable authoritative zone.
"disable"Disable authoritative zone.
"enable"Enable authoritative zone.
contactstring
Email address of the administrator for this zone. You can specify only the username (e.g. admin) or full email address (e.g. admin@test.com) When using a simple username, the domain of the email will be this zone.
dns-entrytable
domainstring
Domain name.
forwarderIPv4 address array
DNS zone forwarder IP address list.
ip-masterIPv4 address
IP address of master DNS server. Entries in this master DNS server and imported into the DNS zone.
namestring, master key
Zone name.
primary-namestring
Domain name of the default DNS server for this zone.
rr-maxunsigned int32
Maximum number of resource records (10 - 65536, 0 means infinite).
source-ipIPv4 address
Source IP for forwarding to DNS server.
statusoption
Enable/disable this DNS zone.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
ttlunsigned int32
Default time-to-live value for the entries of this DNS zone (0 - 2147483647 sec, default = 86400).
typeoption
Zone type (master to manage entries directly, slave to import entries from other zones).
"master"Master DNS zone, to manage entries directly.
"slave"Slave DNS zone, to import entries from other DNS zones.
viewoption
Zone view (public to serve public clients, shadow to serve internal clients).
"shadow"Shadow DNS zone to serve internal clients.
"public"Public DNS zone to serve public clients.

 

system/dns-database/dns-entry (table)

DNS entry.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:

Attribute ListDescriptions

Canonical name of the host.
hostnamestring
Name of the host.
idsequence, master key
DNS entry ID.
ipIPv4 address
IPv4 address of the host.
ipv6IPv6 address
IPv6 address of the host.
preferenceunsigned int32
DNS entry preference, 0 is the highest preference (0 - 65535, default = 10)
statusoption
Enable/disable resource record status.
"disable"Disable resource record status.
"enable"Enable resource record status.
ttlunsigned int32
Time-to-live for this entry (0 to 2147483647 sec, default = 0).
typeoption
Resource record type.
"NS"Name server type.
"MX"Mail exchange type.
"CNAME"Canonical name type.
"A"Host type.
"AAAA"IPv6 host type.
"PTR"Pointer type.
"PTR_V6"IPv6 pointer type.
