system/modem (object)

Configure MODEM.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/modem
Attribute ListDescriptions
altmodeoption
Enable/disable altmode for installations using PPP in China.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
authtype1flags
Allowed authentication types for ISP 1.
"pap"PAP
"chap"CHAP
"mschapv2"MSCHAPv2
"mschap"MSCHAP
authtype2flags
Allowed authentication types for ISP 2.
"pap"PAP
"chap"CHAP
"mschapv2"MSCHAPv2
"mschap"MSCHAP
authtype3flags
Allowed authentication types for ISP 3.
"pap"PAP
"chap"CHAP
"mschapv2"MSCHAPv2
"mschap"MSCHAP
auto-dialoption
Enable/disable auto-dial after a reboot or disconnection.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
connect-timeoutunsigned int32
Connection completion timeout (30 - 255 sec, default = 90).
dial-cmd1string
Dial command (this is often an ATD or ATDT command).
dial-cmd2string
Dial command (this is often an ATD or ATDT command).
dial-cmd3string
Dial command (this is often an ATD or ATDT command).
dial-on-demandoption
Enable/disable to dial the modem when packets are routed to the modem interface.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
distanceunsigned int32
Distance of learned routes (1 - 255, default = 1).
dont-send-CR1option
Do not send CR when connected (ISP1).
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
dont-send-CR2option
Do not send CR when connected (ISP2).
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
dont-send-CR3option
Do not send CR when connected (ISP3).
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
extra-init1string
Extra initialization string to ISP 1.
extra-init2string
Extra initialization string to ISP 2.
extra-init3string
Extra initialization string to ISP 3.
holddown-timerunsigned int32
Hold down timer in seconds (1 - 60 sec).
idle-timerunsigned int32
MODEM connection idle time (1 - 9999 min, default = 5).
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Name of redundant interface.
lockdown-lacstring
Allow connection only to the specified Location Area Code (LAC).
modeoption
Set MODEM operation mode to redundant or standalone.
"standalone"Standalone.
"redundant"Redundant for an interface.
network-initstring
AT command to set the Network name/type (AT+COPS=<mode>,[<format>,<oper>[,<AcT>]]).
passwd1password
Password to access the specified dialup account.
passwd2password
Password to access the specified dialup account.
passwd3password
Password to access the specified dialup account.
peer-modem1option
Specify peer MODEM type for phone1.
"generic"All other modem type.
"actiontec"ActionTec modem.
"ascend_TNT"Ascend TNT modem.
peer-modem2option
Specify peer MODEM type for phone2.
"generic"All other modem type.
"actiontec"ActionTec modem.
"ascend_TNT"Ascend TNT modem.
peer-modem3option
Specify peer MODEM type for phone3.
"generic"All other modem type.
"actiontec"ActionTec modem.
"ascend_TNT"Ascend TNT modem.
phone1string
Phone number to connect to the dialup account (must not contain spaces, and should include standard special characters).
phone2string
Phone number to connect to the dialup account (must not contain spaces, and should include standard special characters).
phone3string
Phone number to connect to the dialup account (must not contain spaces, and should include standard special characters).
pin-initstring
AT command to set the PIN (AT+PIN=<pin>).
ppp-echo-request1option
Enable/disable PPP echo-request to ISP 1.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
ppp-echo-request2option
Enable/disable PPP echo-request to ISP 2.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
ppp-echo-request3option
Enable/disable PPP echo-request to ISP 3.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
priorityunsigned int32
Priority of learned routes (0 - 4294967295, default = 0).
redialoption
Redial limit (1 - 10 attempts, none = redial forever).
"none"Forever.
"1"One attempt.
"2"Two attempts.
"3"Three attempts.
"4"Four attempts.
"5"Five attempts.
"6"Six attempts.
"7"Seven attempts.
"8"Eight attempts.
"9"Nine attempts.
"10"Ten attempts.
resetunsigned int32
Number of dial attempts before resetting modem (0 = never reset).
statusoption
Enable/disable Modem support (equivalent to bringing an interface up or down).
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
username1string
User name to access the specified dialup account.
username2string
User name to access the specified dialup account.
username3string
User name to access the specified dialup account.
wireless-portunsigned int32
Enter wireless port number, 0 for default, 1 for first port, ... (0 - 4294967295, default = 0)

system/np6 (table)

Configure NP6 attributes.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/np6
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/np6/<np6_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
fastpathoption
Enable/disable NP4 or NP6 offloading (also called fast path).
"disable"Disable NP4 or NP6 offloading (fast path).
"enable"Enable NP4 or NP6 offloading (fast path).
fp-anomalyobject
garbage-session-collectoroption
Enable/disable garbage session collector.
"disable"Disable garbage session collector.
"enable"Enable garbage session collector.
hpeobject
ipsec-ob-hash-functionoption
Set hash function for IPSec outbound.
"global-hash"Hash outbound SA traffic among all NPs.
"round-robin-global"Round-robin outbound SA traffic among all NPs.
"switch-group-hash"Hash outbound SA traffic within NPs connected to same switch.
"global-hash-weighted"Hash outbound SA traffic among all NPs with more weights on NPs connected to switch 0. It's applicable to the case that ingress traffic is from switch 1.
"round-robin-switch-group"Round-robin outbound SA traffic within NPs connected to same switch.
ipsec-outbound-hashoption
Enable/disable hash function for IPsec outbound traffic.
"disable"Disable hash function for IPsec outbound traffic.
"enable"Enable hash function for IPsec outbound traffic.
low-latency-modeoption
Enable/disable low latency mode.
"disable"Disable low latency mode.
"enable"Enable low latency mode.
namestring, master key
Device Name.
per-session-accountingoption
Enable/disable per-session accounting.
"enable"Per-session accounting for all sessions.
"disable"Disable per-session accounting.
"traffic-log-only"Per-session accounting only for sessions with traffic logging enabled in firewall policy.
session-collector-intervalunsigned int32
Set garbage session collection cleanup interval (1 - 100 sec, default 64).
session-timeout-fixedoption
{disable | enable} Toggle between using fixed or random timeouts for refreshing NP6 sessions.
"disable"Disable Refresh NP6 sessions at the configured fixed interval.
"enable"Enable Refresh NP6 sessions randomly where the time between refreshes is within the random range.
session-timeout-intervalunsigned int32
Set the fixed timeout for refreshing NP6 sessions (0 - 1000 sec, default 40 sec).
session-timeout-random-rangeunsigned int32
Set the random timeout range for refreshing NP6 sessions (0 - 1000 sec, default 8 sec).

 

system/np6/fp-anomaly (object)

NP6 IPv4 anomaly protection. trap-to-host forwards anomaly sessions to the CPU.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/np6/<np6_name>/fp-anomaly
Attribute ListDescriptions
icmp-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 ICMP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid ICMP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid ICMP checksum to main CPU for processing.
icmp-fragoption
Layer 3 fragmented packets that could be part of layer 4 ICMP anomalies.
"allow"Allow L3 fragment packet with L4 protocol as ICMP attack to pass.
"drop"Drop L3 fragment packet with L4 protocol as ICMP attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward L3 fragment packet with L4 protocol as ICMP attack to FortiOS.
icmp-landoption
ICMP land anomalies.
"allow"Allow ICMP land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop ICMP land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward ICMP land attack to FortiOS.
ipv4-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 IP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid IP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid IP checksum to main CPU for processing.
ipv4-landoption
Land anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 land attack to FortiOS.
ipv4-optlsrroption
Loose source record route option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with loose source record route option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with loose source record route option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with loose source record route option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optrroption
Record route option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with record route option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with record route option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with record route option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optsecurityoption
Security option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with security option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with security option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with security option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optssrroption
Strict source record route option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with strict source record route option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with strict source record route option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with strict source record route option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optstreamoption
Stream option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with stream option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with stream option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with stream option to FortiOS.
ipv4-opttimestampoption
Timestamp option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with timestamp option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with timestamp option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with timestamp option to FortiOS.
ipv4-proto-erroption
Invalid layer 4 protocol anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 invalid L4 protocol to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid L4 protocol.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid L4 protocol to FortiOS.
ipv4-unknoptoption
Unknown option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with unknown options to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with unknown options.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with unknown options to FortiOS.
ipv6-daddr-erroption
Destination address as unspecified or loopback address anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with destination address as unspecified or loopback address to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with destination address as unspecified or loopback address.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with destination address as unspecified or loopback address to FortiOS.
ipv6-landoption
Land anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 land attack to FortiOS.
ipv6-optendpidoption
End point identification anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with end point identification option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with end point identification option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with end point identification option to FortiOS.
ipv6-opthomeaddroption
Home address option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with home address option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with home address option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with home address option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optinvldoption
Invalid option anomalies.Invalid option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with invalid option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with invalid option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with invalid option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optjumbooption
Jumbo options anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with jumbo option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with jumbo option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with jumbo option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optnsapoption
Network service access point address option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with network service access point address option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with network service access point address option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with network service access point address option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optralertoption
Router alert option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with router alert option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with router alert option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with router alert option to FortiOS.
ipv6-opttunneloption
Tunnel encapsulation limit option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with tunnel encapsulation limit to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with tunnel encapsulation limit.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with tunnel encapsulation limit to FortiOS.
ipv6-proto-erroption
Layer 4 invalid protocol anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 L4 invalid protocol to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 L4 invalid protocol.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 L4 invalid protocol to FortiOS.
ipv6-saddr-erroption
Source address as multicast anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with source address as multicast to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with source address as multicast.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with source address as multicast to FortiOS.
ipv6-unknoptoption
Unknown option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with unknown options to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with unknown options.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with unknown options to FortiOS.
tcp-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 TCP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid TCP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid TCP checksum to main CPU for processing.
tcp-fin-noackoption
TCP SYN flood with FIN flag set without ACK setting anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets with FIN flag set without ack setting to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets with FIN flag set without ack setting.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets with FIN flag set without ack setting to FortiOS.
tcp-fin-onlyoption
TCP SYN flood with only FIN flag set anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets with FIN flag set only to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets with FIN flag set only.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets with FIN flag set only to FortiOS.
tcp-landoption
TCP land anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP land attack to FortiOS.
tcp-no-flagoption
TCP SYN flood with no flag set anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets without flag set to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets without flag set.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets without flag set to FortiOS.
tcp-syn-dataoption
TCP SYN flood packets with data anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP syn packets with data to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP syn packets with data.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP syn packets with data to FortiOS.
tcp-syn-finoption
TCP SYN flood SYN/FIN flag set anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets with syn_fin flag set to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets with syn_fin flag set.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets with syn_fin flag set to FortiOS.
tcp-winnukeoption
TCP WinNuke anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets winnuke attack to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets winnuke attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets winnuke attack to FortiOS.
udp-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 UDP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid UDP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid UDP checksum to main CPU for processing.
udp-landoption
UDP land anomalies.
"allow"Allow UDP land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop UDP land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward UDP land attack to FortiOS.

 

system/np6/hpe (object)

HPE configuration.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/np6/<np6_name>/hpe
Attribute ListDescriptions
arp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum ARP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
enable-shaperoption
Enable/Disable NPU Host Protection Engine (HPE) for packet type shaper.
"disable"Disable NPU HPE shaping based on packet type.
"enable"Enable NPU HPE shaping based on packet type.
esp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum ESP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
icmp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum ICMP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
ip-frag-maxunsigned int32
Maximum fragmented IP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
ip-others-maxunsigned int32
Maximum IP packet rate for other packets (packet types that cannot be set with other options) (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
l2-others-maxunsigned int32
Maximum L2 packet rate for L2 packets that are not ARP packets (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
pri-type-maxunsigned int32
Maximum overflow rate of priority type traffic (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps). Includes L2: HA, 802.3ad LACP, heartbeats. L3: OSPF. L4_TCP: BGP. L4_UDP: IKE, SLBC, BFD.
sctp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum SCTP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 200K pps).
tcp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum TCP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 600K pps).
tcpsyn-maxunsigned int32
Maximum TCP SYN packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 600K pps).
udp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum UDP packet rate (1K - 1G pps, default = 600K pps).

"disable"Disable per-session accounting.
"traffic-log-only"Per-session accounting only for sessions with traffic logging enabled in firewall policy.

"disable"Disable NPU session timeout at fixed interval.
"enable"Enable NPU session timeout at fixed interval.

Set session timeout interval (0 - 1000 sec, default 40 sec).
session-timeout-random-rangeunsigned int32
Set the randomization range (0 - 1000 sec, default 8 sec).

 

system/np6xlite/fp-anomaly (object)

NP6XLITE IPv4 anomaly protection. trap-to-host forwards anomaly sessions to the CPU.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/np6xlite/<np6xlite_name>/fp-anomaly
Attribute ListDescriptions
icmp-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 ICMP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid ICMP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid ICMP checksum to main CPU for processing.
icmp-fragoption
Layer 3 fragmented packets that could be part of layer 4 ICMP anomalies.
"allow"Allow L3 fragment packet with L4 protocol as ICMP attack to pass.
"drop"Drop L3 fragment packet with L4 protocol as ICMP attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward L3 fragment packet with L4 protocol as ICMP attack to FortiOS.
icmp-landoption
ICMP land anomalies.
"allow"Allow ICMP land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop ICMP land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward ICMP land attack to FortiOS.
ipv4-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 IP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid IP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid IP checksum to main CPU for processing.
ipv4-landoption
Land anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 land attack to FortiOS.
ipv4-optlsrroption
Loose source record route option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with loose source record route option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with loose source record route option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with loose source record route option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optrroption
Record route option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with record route option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with record route option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with record route option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optsecurityoption
Security option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with security option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with security option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with security option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optssrroption
Strict source record route option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with strict source record route option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with strict source record route option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with strict source record route option to FortiOS.
ipv4-optstreamoption
Stream option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with stream option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with stream option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with stream option to FortiOS.
ipv4-opttimestampoption
Timestamp option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with timestamp option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with timestamp option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with timestamp option to FortiOS.
ipv4-proto-erroption
Invalid layer 4 protocol anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 invalid L4 protocol to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid L4 protocol.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid L4 protocol to FortiOS.
ipv4-unknoptoption
Unknown option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv4 with unknown options to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv4 with unknown options.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 with unknown options to FortiOS.
ipv6-daddr-erroption
Destination address as unspecified or loopback address anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with destination address as unspecified or loopback address to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with destination address as unspecified or loopback address.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with destination address as unspecified or loopback address to FortiOS.
ipv6-landoption
Land anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 land attack to FortiOS.
ipv6-optendpidoption
End point identification anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with end point identification option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with end point identification option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with end point identification option to FortiOS.
ipv6-opthomeaddroption
Home address option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with home address option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with home address option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with home address option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optinvldoption
Invalid option anomalies.Invalid option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with invalid option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with invalid option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with invalid option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optjumbooption
Jumbo options anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with jumbo option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with jumbo option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with jumbo option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optnsapoption
Network service access point address option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with network service access point address option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with network service access point address option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with network service access point address option to FortiOS.
ipv6-optralertoption
Router alert option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with router alert option to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with router alert option.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with router alert option to FortiOS.
ipv6-opttunneloption
Tunnel encapsulation limit option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with tunnel encapsulation limit to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with tunnel encapsulation limit.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with tunnel encapsulation limit to FortiOS.
ipv6-proto-erroption
Layer 4 invalid protocol anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 L4 invalid protocol to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 L4 invalid protocol.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 L4 invalid protocol to FortiOS.
ipv6-saddr-erroption
Source address as multicast anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with source address as multicast to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with source address as multicast.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with source address as multicast to FortiOS.
ipv6-unknoptoption
Unknown option anomalies.
"allow"Allow IPv6 with unknown options to pass.
"drop"Drop IPv6 with unknown options.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv6 with unknown options to FortiOS.
tcp-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 TCP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid TCP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid TCP checksum to main CPU for processing.
tcp-fin-noackoption
TCP SYN flood with FIN flag set without ACK setting anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets with FIN flag set without ack setting to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets with FIN flag set without ack setting.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets with FIN flag set without ack setting to FortiOS.
tcp-fin-onlyoption
TCP SYN flood with only FIN flag set anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets with FIN flag set only to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets with FIN flag set only.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets with FIN flag set only to FortiOS.
tcp-landoption
TCP land anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP land attack to FortiOS.
tcp-no-flagoption
TCP SYN flood with no flag set anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets without flag set to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets without flag set.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets without flag set to FortiOS.
tcp-syn-dataoption
TCP SYN flood packets with data anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP syn packets with data to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP syn packets with data.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP syn packets with data to FortiOS.
tcp-syn-finoption
TCP SYN flood SYN/FIN flag set anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets with syn_fin flag set to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets with syn_fin flag set.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets with syn_fin flag set to FortiOS.
tcp-winnukeoption
TCP WinNuke anomalies.
"allow"Allow TCP packets winnuke attack to pass.
"drop"Drop TCP packets winnuke attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward TCP packets winnuke attack to FortiOS.
udp-csum-erroption
Invalid IPv4 UDP checksum anomalies.
"drop"Drop IPv4 invalid UDP checksum.
"trap-to-host"Forward IPv4 invalid UDP checksum to main CPU for processing.
udp-landoption
UDP land anomalies.
"allow"Allow UDP land attack to pass.
"drop"Drop UDP land attack.
"trap-to-host"Forward UDP land attack to FortiOS.

 

system/np6xlite/hpe (object)

HPE configuration.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/np6xlite/<np6xlite_name>/hpe
Attribute ListDescriptions
arp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum ARP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
enable-shaperoption
Enable/Disable NPU host protection engine (HPE) shaper.
"disable"Disable NPU HPE shaping based on packet type.
"enable"Enable NPU HPE shaping based on packet type.
esp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum ESP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
icmp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum ICMP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
ip-frag-maxunsigned int32
Maximum fragmented IP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
ip-others-maxunsigned int32
Maximum IP packet rate for other packets (packet types that cannot be set with other options) (10G - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
l2-others-maxunsigned int32
Maximum L2 packet rate for L2 packets that are not ARP packets (10K - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
sctp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum SCTP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 1M pps).
tcp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum TCP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 5M pps).
tcpsyn-maxunsigned int32
Maximum TCP SYN packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 5M pps).
udp-maxunsigned int32
Maximum UDP packet rate (10K - 4G pps, default = 5M pps).

 

system/ntp (object)

Configure system NTP information.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/ntp
Attribute ListDescriptions
authenticationoption
Enable/disable authentication.
"disable"Disable authentication.
"enable"Enable authentication.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 256)
FortiGate interface(s) with NTP server mode enabled. Devices on your network can contact these interfaces for NTP services.
keypassword
Key for authentication.
key-idunsigned int32
Key ID for authentication.
key-typeoption
Key type for authentication (MD5, SHA1).
"MD5"Use MD5 to authenticate the message.
"SHA1"Use SHA1 to authenticate the message.
ntpservertable
ntpsyncoption
Enable/disable setting the FortiGate system time by synchronizing with an NTP Server.
"disable"Disable synchronization with NTP Server.
"enable"Enable synchronization with NTP Server.
server-modeoption
Enable/disable FortiGate NTP Server Mode. Your FortiGate becomes an NTP server for other devices on your network. The FortiGate relays NTP requests to its configured NTP server.
"disable"Disable FortiGate NTP Server Mode.
"enable"Enable FortiGate NTP Server Mode.
source-ipIPv4 address
Source IP address for communication to the NTP server.
source-ip6IPv6 address
Source IPv6 address for communication to the NTP server.
syncintervalunsigned int32
NTP synchronization interval (1 - 1440 min).
typeoption
Use the FortiGuard NTP server or any other available NTP Server.
"fortiguard"Use the FortiGuard NTP server.
"custom"Use any other available NTP server.

 

system/ntp/ntpserver (table)

Configure the FortiGate to connect to any available third-party NTP server.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/ntp/ntpserver
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/ntp/ntpserver/<ntpserver_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
authenticationoption
Enable/disable MD5(NTPv3)/SHA1(NTPv4) authentication.
"disable"Disable MD5(NTPv3)/SHA1(NTPv4) authentication.
"enable"Enable MD5(NTPv3)/SHA1(NTPv4) authentication.
idsequence, master key
NTP server ID.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Specify outgoing interface to reach server.
interface-select-methodoption
Specify how to select outgoing interface to reach server.
"auto"Set outgoing interface automatically.
"sdwan"Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules.
"specify"Set outgoing interface manually.
keypassword
Key for MD5(NTPv3)/SHA1(NTPv4) authentication.
key-idunsigned int32
Key ID for authentication.
ntpv3option
Enable to use NTPv3 instead of NTPv4.
"disable"Disable NTPv3 (use NTPv4).
"enable"Enable NTPv3.
serverstring
IP address or hostname of the NTP Server.

 

system/password-policy (object)

Configure password policy for locally defined administrator passwords and IPsec VPN pre-shared keys.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/password-policy
Attribute ListDescriptions
apply-toflags
Apply password policy to administrator passwords or IPsec pre-shared keys or both. Separate entries with a space.
"admin-password"Apply to administrator passwords.
"ipsec-preshared-key"Apply to IPsec pre-shared keys.
change-4-charactersoption
Enable/disable changing at least 4 characters for a new password (This attribute overrides reuse-password if both are enabled).
"disable"No requirements for the number of characters to change in a new password. A new password can be the same as the old password.
"enable"Enable requiring that at least 4 characters must be changed in a new password.
expire-dayunsigned int32
Number of days after which passwords expire (1 - 999 days, default = 90).
expire-statusoption
Enable/disable password expiration.
"disable"Passwords do not expire.
"enable"Passwords expire after expire-day days.
min-lower-case-letterunsigned int32
Minimum number of lowercase characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
min-non-alphanumericunsigned int32
Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
min-numberunsigned int32
Minimum number of numeric characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
min-upper-case-letterunsigned int32
Minimum number of uppercase characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
minimum-lengthunsigned int32
Minimum password length (8 - 128, default = 8).
reuse-passwordoption
Enable/disable reusing of password (if both reuse-password and change-4-characters are enabled, change-4-characters overrides).
"disable"Administrators must create a new password.
"enable"Administrators are allowed to reuse the same password.
statusoption
Enable/disable setting a password policy for locally defined administrator passwords and IPsec VPN pre-shared keys.
"disable"Disable password policy.
"enable"Enable password policy.

apply-toflags

"disable"No requirements for the number of characters to change in a new password. A new password can be the same as the old password.
"enable"Enable requiring that at least 4 characters must be changed in a new password.
expire-dayunsigned int32
Number of days after which passwords expire (1 - 999 days, default = 90).
expire-statusoption
Enable/disable password expiration.
"disable"Passwords do not expire.
"enable"Passwords expire after expire-day days.
min-lower-case-letterunsigned int32
Minimum number of lowercase characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
min-non-alphanumericunsigned int32
Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
min-numberunsigned int32
Minimum number of numeric characters in password (0 - 128, default = 0).
min-upper-case-letterunsigned int32

minimum-lengthunsigned int32

"disable"Administrators must create a new password.
"enable"Administrators are allowed to reuse the same password.
statusoption

"disable"Disable password policy.
"enable"Enable password policy.

Attribute ListDescriptions
ac-namestring
PPPoE AC name.
auth-typeoption
PPP authentication type to use.
"auto"Automatically choose the authentication method.
"pap"PAP authentication.
"chap"CHAP authentication.
"mschapv1"MS-CHAPv1 authentication.
"mschapv2"MS-CHAPv2 authentication.
devicedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Name for the physical interface.
dial-on-demandoption
Enable/disable dial on demand to dial the PPPoE interface when packets are routed to the PPPoE interface.
"disable"Disable dial on demand.
"enable"Enable dial on demand.
disc-retry-timeoutunsigned int32
PPPoE discovery init timeout value in (0-4294967295 sec).
idle-timeoutunsigned int32
PPPoE auto disconnect after idle timeout (0-4294967295 sec).
ipunnumberedIPv4 address
PPPoE unnumbered IP.
ipv6option
Enable/disable IPv6 Control Protocol (IPv6CP).
"disable"Disable IPv6CP.
"enable"Enable IPv6CP.
lcp-echo-intervalunsigned int32
Time in seconds between PPPoE Link Control Protocol (LCP) echo requests.
lcp-max-echo-failsunsigned int32
Maximum missed LCP echo messages before disconnect.
namestring, master key
Name of the PPPoE interface.
padt-retry-timeoutunsigned int32
PPPoE terminate timeout value in (0-4294967295 sec).
passwordpassword
Enter the password.
pppoe-unnumbered-negotiateoption
Enable/disable PPPoE unnumbered negotiation.
"disable"Disable PPPoE unnumbered negotiation.
"enable"Enable PPPoE unnumbered negotiation.
service-namestring
PPPoE service name.
usernamestring
User name.

"decrease"Decrease TTL.

system/ptp (object)

Configure system PTP information.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/ptp
Attribute ListDescriptions
delay-mechanismoption
End to end delay detection or peer to peer delay detection.
"E2E"End to end delay detection.
"P2P"Peer to peer delay detection.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
PTP slave will reply through this interface.
modeoption
Multicast transmission or hybrid transmission.
"multicast"Send PTP packets with multicast.
"hybrid"Send PTP packets with unicast and multicast.
request-intervalunsigned int32
The delay request value is the logarithmic mean interval in seconds between the delay request messages sent by the slave to the master.
statusoption
Enable/disable setting the FortiGate system time by synchronizing with an PTP Server.
"disable"Disable synchronization with PTP Server.
"enable"Enable synchronization with PTP Server.

Format flag.
"none"No format type.
"text"Text format.
"html"HTML format.
headeroption
Header flag.
"none"No header type.
"http"HTTP
"8bit"8 bit.
msg-typestring, master key
Message type.

system/saml (object)

Global settings for SAML authentication.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/saml
Attribute ListDescriptions
artifact-resolution-urlstring
SP artifact resolution URL.
binding-protocoloption
Binding protocol.
"post"HTTP POST binding.
certdatasource, refer to certificate local, or vpn certificate local (maximum 1)
Certificate to sign SAML messages.
default-login-pageoption
Choose default login page.
"normal"Use local login page as default.
"sso"Use IdP's Single Sign-On page as default.
default-profiledatasource, refer to system accprofile (maximum 1)
Default profile for new SSO admin.
entity-idstring
idp-artifact-resolution-urlstring
IDP artifact resolution URL.
idp-certdatasource, refer to certificate remote, or vpn certificate remote (maximum 1)
IDP certificate name.
idp-entity-idstring
IDP entity ID.
idp-single-logout-urlstring
IDP single logout URL.
idp-single-sign-on-urlstring
IDP single sign-on URL.
lifeunsigned int32
Length of the range of time when the assertion is valid (in minutes).
portal-urlstring
roleoption
SAML role.
"identity-provider"Identity Provider.
"service-provider"Service Provider.
server-addressstring
Server address.
service-providerstable
single-logout-urlstring
single-sign-on-urlstring
statusoption
Enable/disable SAML authentication (default = disable).
"disable"Disable SAML authentication.
"enable"Enable SAML authentication.
toleranceunsigned int32
Tolerance to the range of time when the assertion is valid (in minutes).

system/sdwan (object)

Configure redundant Internet connections with multiple outbound links and health-check profiles.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan
Attribute ListDescriptions
duplicationtable
duplication-max-numunsigned int32
Maximum number of interface members a packet is duplicated in the SD-WAN zone (2 - 4, default = 2; if set to 3, the original packet plus 2 more copies are created).
fail-alert-interfacesdatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 256)
Physical interfaces that will be alerted.
fail-detectoption
Enable/disable SD-WAN Internet connection status checking (failure detection).
"disable"Disable status checking.
"enable"Enable status checking.
health-checktable
load-balance-modeoption
Algorithm or mode to use for load balancing Internet traffic to SD-WAN members.
"source-ip-based"Source IP load balancing. All traffic from a source IP is sent to the same interface.
"weight-based"Weight-based load balancing. Interfaces with higher weights have higher priority and get more traffic.
"usage-based"Usage-based load balancing. All traffic is sent to the first interface on the list. When the bandwidth on that interface exceeds the spill-over limit new traffic is sent to the next interface.
"source-dest-ip-based"Source and destination IP load balancing. All traffic from a source IP to a destination IP is sent to the same interface.
"measured-volume-based"Volume-based load balancing. Traffic is load balanced based on traffic volume (in bytes). More traffic is sent to interfaces with higher volume ratios.
memberstable
neighbortable
neighbor-hold-boot-timeunsigned int32
Waiting period in seconds when switching from the primary neighbor to the secondary neighbor from the neighbor start. (0 - 10000000, default = 0).
neighbor-hold-downoption
Enable/disable hold switching from the secondary neighbor to the primary neighbor.
"disable"Disable hold switching from the secondary neighbor to the primary neighbor.
"enable"Enable hold switching from the secondary neighbor to the primary neighbor.
neighbor-hold-down-timeunsigned int32
Waiting period in seconds when switching from the secondary neighbor to the primary neighbor when hold-down is disabled. (0 - 10000000, default = 0).
servicetable
statusoption
Enable/disable SD-WAN.
"disable"Disable SD-WAN.
"enable"Enable SD-WAN.
zonetable

 

system/sdwan/duplication (table)

Create SD-WAN duplication rule.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/duplication
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/duplication/<duplication_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
dstaddrdatasource, refer to firewall address, or firewall addrgrp
Destination address or address group names.
dstaddr6datasource, refer to firewall address6, or firewall addrgrp6
Destination address6 or address6 group names.
dstintfdatasource, refer to system interface, system sdwan zone, system zone, or dynamic interface
Outgoing (egress) interfaces or zones.
idunsigned int32, master key
Duplication rule ID (1 - 255).
packet-de-duplicationoption
Enable/disable discarding of packets that have been duplicated.
"disable"Disable discarding of packets that have been duplicated.
"enable"Enable discarding of packets that have been duplicated.
packet-duplicationoption
Configure packet duplication method.
"disable"Disable packet duplication.
"force"Duplicate packets across all interface members of the SD-WAN zone.
"on-demand"Duplicate packets across all interface members of the SD-WAN zone based on the link quality.
servicedatasource, refer to firewall service custom, or firewall service group
Service and service group name.
srcaddrdatasource, refer to firewall address, or firewall addrgrp
Source address or address group names.
srcaddr6datasource, refer to firewall address6, or firewall addrgrp6
Source address6 or address6 group names.
srcintfdatasource, refer to system interface, system sdwan zone, system zone, or dynamic interface
Incoming (ingress) interfaces or zones.

 

system/sdwan/health-check (table)

SD-WAN status checking or health checking. Identify a server on the Internet and determine how SD-WAN verifies that the FortiGate can communicate with it.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/health-check
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/health-check/<health-check_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
addr-modeoption
Address mode (IPv4 or IPv6).
"ipv4"IPv4 mode.
"ipv6"IPv6 mode.
diffservcodestring
Differentiated services code point (DSCP) in the IP header of the probe packet.
dns-match-ipIPv4 address
Response IP expected from DNS server if the protocol is DNS.
dns-request-domainstring
Fully qualified domain name to resolve for the DNS probe.
failtimeunsigned int32
Number of failures before server is considered lost (1 - 3600, default = 5).
ftp-filestring
Full path and file name on the FTP server to download for FTP health-check to probe.
ftp-modeoption
FTP mode.
"passive"The FTP health-check initiates and establishes the data connection.
"port"The FTP server initiates and establishes the data connection.
ha-priorityunsigned int32
HA election priority (1 - 50).
http-agentstring
String in the http-agent field in the HTTP header.
http-getstring
URL used to communicate with the server if the protocol if the protocol is HTTP.
http-matchstring
Response string expected from the server if the protocol is HTTP.
intervalunsigned int32
Status check interval in milliseconds, or the time between attempting to connect to the server (500 - 3600*1000 msec, default = 500).
membersdatasource, refer to system sdwan members
Member sequence number list.
namestring, master key
Status check or health check name.
packet-sizeunsigned int32
Packet size of a twamp test session,
passwordpassword
Twamp controller password in authentication mode
portunsigned int32
Port number used to communicate with the server over the selected protocol (0-65535, default = 0, auto select. http, twamp: 80, udp-echo, tcp-echo: 7, dns: 53, ftp: 21).
probe-countunsigned int32
Number of most recent probes that should be used to calculate latency and jitter (5 - 30, default = 30).
probe-packetsoption
Enable/disable transmission of probe packets.
"disable"Disable transmission of probe packets.
"enable"Enable transmission of probe packets.
probe-timeoutunsigned int32
Time to wait before a probe packet is considered lost (500 - 3600*1000 msec, default = 500).
protocoloption
Protocol used to determine if the FortiGate can communicate with the server.
"ping"Use PING to test the link with the server.
"tcp-echo"Use TCP echo to test the link with the server.
"udp-echo"Use UDP echo to test the link with the server.
"http"Use HTTP-GET to test the link with the server.
"twamp"Use TWAMP to test the link with the server.
"ping6"
"dns"Use DNS query to test the link with the server.
"tcp-connect"Use a full TCP connection to test the link with the server.
"ftp"Use FTP to test the link with the server.
quality-measured-methodoption
Method to measure the quality of tcp-connect.
"half-close"Measure the round trip between fin and ack.
"half-open"Measure the round trip between syn and ack.
recoverytimeunsigned int32
Number of successful responses received before server is considered recovered (1 - 3600, default = 5).
security-modeoption
Twamp controller security mode.
"none"Unauthenticated mode.
"authentication"Authenticated mode.
serverstring array
IP address or FQDN name of the server.
slatable
sla-fail-log-periodunsigned int32
Time interval in seconds that SLA fail log messages will be generated (0 - 3600, default = 0).
sla-pass-log-periodunsigned int32
Time interval in seconds that SLA pass log messages will be generated (0 - 3600, default = 0).
system-dnsoption
Enable/disable system DNS as the probe server.
"disable"Disable system DNS as the probe server.
"enable"Enable system DNS as the probe server.
threshold-alert-jitterunsigned int32
Alert threshold for jitter (ms, default = 0).
threshold-alert-latencyunsigned int32
Alert threshold for latency (ms, default = 0).
threshold-alert-packetlossunsigned int32
Alert threshold for packet loss (percentage, default = 0).
threshold-warning-jitterunsigned int32
Warning threshold for jitter (ms, default = 0).
threshold-warning-latencyunsigned int32
Warning threshold for latency (ms, default = 0).
threshold-warning-packetlossunsigned int32
Warning threshold for packet loss (percentage, default = 0).
update-cascade-interfaceoption
Enable/disable update cascade interface.
"disable"Disable update cascade interface.
"enable"Enable update cascade interface.
update-static-routeoption
Enable/disable updating the static route.
"disable"Disable updating the static route.
"enable"Enable updating the static route.
userstring
The user name to access probe server.

 

system/sdwan/health-check/sla (table)

Service level agreement (SLA).

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/health-check/<health-check_name>/sla
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/health-check/<health-check_name>/sla/<sla_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
idunsigned int32, master key
SLA ID.
jitter-thresholdunsigned int32
Jitter for SLA to make decision in milliseconds. (0 - 10000000, default = 5).
latency-thresholdunsigned int32
Latency for SLA to make decision in milliseconds. (0 - 10000000, default = 5).
link-cost-factorflags
Criteria on which to base link selection.
"latency"Select link based on latency.
"jitter"Select link based on jitter.
"packet-loss"Select link based on packet loss.
packetloss-thresholdunsigned int32
Packet loss for SLA to make decision in percentage. (0 - 100, default = 0).

 

system/sdwan/members (table)

FortiGate interfaces added to the SD-WAN.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/members
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/members/<members_seq-num>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comments.
costunsigned int32
Cost of this interface for services in SLA mode (0 - 4294967295, default = 0).
gatewayIPv4 address
The default gateway for this interface. Usually the default gateway of the Internet service provider that this interface is connected to.
gateway6IPv6 address
IPv6 gateway.
ingress-spillover-thresholdunsigned int32
Ingress spillover threshold for this interface (0 - 16776000 kbit/s). When this traffic volume threshold is reached, new sessions spill over to other interfaces in the SD-WAN.
interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Interface name.
priorityunsigned int32
Priority of the interface (0 - 65535). Used for SD-WAN rules or priority rules.
seq-numsequence, master key
Sequence number(1-512).
sourceIPv4 address
Source IP address used in the health-check packet to the server.
source6IPv6 address
Source IPv6 address used in the health-check packet to the server.
spillover-thresholdunsigned int32
Egress spillover threshold for this interface (0 - 16776000 kbit/s). When this traffic volume threshold is reached, new sessions spill over to other interfaces in the SD-WAN.
statusoption
Enable/disable this interface in the SD-WAN.
"disable"Disable this interface in the SD-WAN.
"enable"Enable this interface in the SD-WAN.
volume-ratiounsigned int32
Measured volume ratio (this value / sum of all values = percentage of link volume, 1 - 255).
weightunsigned int32
Weight of this interface for weighted load balancing. (1 - 255) More traffic is directed to interfaces with higher weights.
zonedatasource, refer to system sdwan zone (maximum 1)
Zone name.

Attribute ListDescriptions

SD-WAN health-check name.
ipdatasource, refer to router bgp neighbor, or router bgp neighbor-group (maximum 1), master key
IP/IPv6 address of neighbor.
memberdatasource, refer to system sdwan members (maximum 1)
Member sequence number.
roleoption
Role of neighbor.
"primary"Primary neighbor.
"secondary"Secondary neighbor.
"standalone"Standalone neighbor.
sla-idunsigned int32
SLA ID.

 

system/sdwan/service (table)

Create SD-WAN rules (also called services) to control how sessions are distributed to interfaces in the SD-WAN.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/service
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/sdwan/service/<service_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
addr-modeoption
Address mode (IPv4 or IPv6).
"ipv4"IPv4 mode.
"ipv6"IPv6 mode.
bandwidth-weightunsigned int32
Coefficient of reciprocal of available bidirectional bandwidth in the formula of custom-profile-1.
defaultoption
Enable/disable use of SD-WAN as default service.
"disable"Disable use of SD-WAN as default service.
"enable"Enable use of SD-WAN as default service.
dscp-forwardoption
Enable/disable forward traffic DSCP tag.
"disable"Disable use of forward DSCP tag.
"enable"Enable use of forward DSCP tag.
dscp-forward-tagstring
Forward traffic DSCP tag.
dscp-reverseoption
Enable/disable reverse traffic DSCP tag.
"disable"Disable use of reverse DSCP tag.
"enable"Enable use of reverse DSCP tag.
dscp-reverse-tagstring
Reverse traffic DSCP tag.
dstdatasource, refer to firewall address, or firewall addrgrp
Destination address name.
dst-negateoption
Enable/disable negation of destination address match.
"disable"Disable destination address negation.
"enable"Enable destination address negation.
dst6datasource, refer to firewall address6, or firewall addrgrp6
Destination address6 name.
end-portunsigned int32
End destination port number.
gatewayoption
Enable/disable SD-WAN service gateway.
"disable"Disable SD-WAN service gateway.
"enable"Enable SD-WAN service gateway.
groupsdatasource, refer to user group
User groups.
hash-modeoption
Hash algorithm for selected priority members for load balance mode.
"round-robin"All traffic are distributed to selected interfaces in equal portions and circular order.
"source-ip-based"All traffic from a source IP is sent to the same interface.
"source-dest-ip-based"All traffic from a source IP to a destination IP is sent to the same interface.
"inbandwidth"All traffic are distributed to a selected interface with most available bandwidth for incoming traffic.
"outbandwidth"All traffic are distributed to a selected interface with most available bandwidth for outgoing traffic.
"bibandwidth"All traffic are distributed to a selected interface with most available bandwidth for both incoming and outgoing traffic.
health-checkdatasource, refer to system sdwan health-check
Health check list.
hold-down-timeunsigned int32
Waiting period in seconds when switching from the back-up member to the primary member (0 - 10000000, default = 0).
idsequence, master key
SD-WAN rule ID (1 - 4000).
input-devicedatasource, refer to system interface, or dynamic interface
Source interface name.
input-device-negateoption
Enable/disable negation of input device match.
"disable"Disable negation of input device match.
"enable"Enable negation of input device match.
internet-serviceoption
Enable/disable use of Internet service for application-based load balancing.
"disable"Disable cloud service to support application-based load balancing.
"enable"Enable cloud service to support application-based load balancing.
internet-service-app-ctrlint array
Application control based Internet Service ID list.
internet-service-app-ctrl-groupdatasource, refer to application group
Application control based Internet Service group list.
internet-service-customdatasource, refer to firewall internet-service-custom
Custom Internet service name list.
internet-service-custom-groupdatasource, refer to firewall internet-service-custom-group
Custom Internet Service group list.
internet-service-groupdatasource, refer to firewall internet-service-group
Internet Service group list.
internet-service-namedatasource, refer to firewall internet-service-name
Internet service name list.
jitter-weightunsigned int32
Coefficient of jitter in the formula of custom-profile-1.
latency-weightunsigned int32
Coefficient of latency in the formula of custom-profile-1.
link-cost-factoroption
Link cost factor.
"latency"Select link based on latency.
"jitter"Select link based on jitter.
"packet-loss"Select link based on packet loss.
"inbandwidth"Select link based on available bandwidth of incoming traffic.
"outbandwidth"Select link based on available bandwidth of outgoing traffic.
"bibandwidth"Select link based on available bandwidth of bidirectional traffic.
"custom-profile-1"Select link based on customized profile.
link-cost-thresholdunsigned int32
Percentage threshold change of link cost values that will result in policy route regeneration (0 - 10000000, default = 10).
minimum-sla-meet-membersunsigned int32
Minimum number of members which meet SLA.
modeoption
Control how the SD-WAN rule sets the priority of interfaces in the SD-WAN.
"auto"Assign interfaces a priority based on quality.
"manual"Assign interfaces a priority manually.
"priority"Assign interfaces a priority based on the link-cost-factor quality of the interface.
"sla"Assign interfaces a priority based on selected SLA settings.
"load-balance"Distribute traffic among all available links based on round robin. ADVPN feature is not supported in the mode.
namestring
SD-WAN rule name.
packet-loss-weightunsigned int32
Coefficient of packet-loss in the formula of custom-profile-1.
priority-membersdatasource, refer to system sdwan members
Member sequence number list.
protocolunsigned int32
Protocol number.
quality-linkunsigned int32
Quality grade.
roleoption
Service role to work with neighbor.
"primary"Primary service for primary neighbor.
"secondary"Secondary service for secondary neighbor.
"standalone"Standalone service.
route-tagunsigned int32
IPv4 route map route-tag.
slatable
sla-compare-methodoption
Method to compare SLA value for SLA mode.
"order"Compare SLA value based on the order of health-check.
"number"Compare SLA value based on the number of satisfied health-check. Limits health-checks to only configured member interfaces.
srcdatasource, refer to firewall address, or firewall addrgrp
Source address name.
src-negateoption
Enable/disable negation of source address match.
"disable"Disable source address negation.
"enable"Enable source address negation.
src6datasource, refer to firewall address6, or firewall addrgrp6
Source address6 name.
standalone-actionoption
Enable/disable service when selected neighbor role is standalone while service role is not standalone.
"disable"Disable service when selected neighbor role is standalone.
"enable"Enable service when selected neighbor role is standalone.
start-portunsigned int32
Start destination port number.
statusoption
Enable/disable SD-WAN service.
"disable"Disable SD-WAN service.
"enable"Enable SD-WAN service.
tosstring
Type of service bit pattern.
tos-maskstring
Type of service evaluated bits.
usersdatasource, refer to user local
User name.

system/session-ttl/port (table)

Session TTL port.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/session-ttl/port
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/session-ttl/port/<port_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
end-portunsigned int32
End port number.
idsequence, master key
Table entry ID.
protocolunsigned int32
Protocol (0 - 255).
start-portunsigned int32
Start port number.
timeoutstring
Session timeout (TTL).

 

system/settings (object)

Configure VDOM settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/system/settings
Attribute ListDescriptions
allow-linkdown-pathoption
Enable/disable link down path.
"disable"Do not allow link down path.
"enable"Allow link down path.
allow-subnet-overlapoption
Enable/disable allowing interface subnets to use overlapping IP addresses.
"disable"Disable overlapping subnets.
"enable"Enable overlapping subnets.
asymrouteoption
Enable/disable IPv4 asymmetric routing.
"disable"Disable IPv4 asymmetric routing.
"enable"Enable IPv4 asymmetric routing.
asymroute-icmpoption
Enable/disable ICMP asymmetric routing.
"disable"Disable ICMP asymmetric routing.
"enable"Enable ICMP asymmetric routing.
asymroute6option
Enable/disable asymmetric IPv6 routing.
"disable"Disable asymmetric IPv6 routing.
"enable"Enable asymmetric IPv6 routing.
asymroute6-icmpoption
Enable/disable asymmetric ICMPv6 routing.
"disable"Disable asymmetric ICMPv6 routing.
"enable"Enable asymmetric ICMPv6 routing.
auxiliary-sessionoption
Enable/disable auxiliary session.
"disable"Disable auxiliary session for this VDOM.
"enable"Enable auxiliary session for this VDOM.
bfdoption
Enable/disable Bi-directional Forwarding Detection (BFD) on all interfaces.
"disable"Disable Bi-directional Forwarding Detection (BFD) on all interfaces.
"enable"Enable Bi-directional Forwarding Detection (BFD) on all interfaces.
bfd-desired-min-txunsigned int32
BFD desired minimal transmit interval (1 - 100000 ms, default = 50).
bfd-detect-multunsigned int32
BFD detection multiplier (1 - 50, default = 3).
bfd-dont-enforce-src-portoption
Enable to not enforce verifying the source port of BFD Packets.
"disable"Disable verifying the source port of BFD Packets.
"enable"Enable verifying the source port of BFD Packets.
bfd-required-min-rxunsigned int32
BFD required minimal receive interval (1 - 100000 ms, default = 50).
block-land-attackoption
Enable/disable blocking of land attacks.
"disable"Do not block land attack.
"enable"Block land attack.
central-natoption
Enable/disable central NAT.
"disable"Disable central NAT.
"enable"Enable central NAT.
commentsstring
VDOM comments.
default-voip-alg-modeoption
Configure how the FortiGate handles VoIP traffic when a policy that accepts the traffic doesn't include a VoIP profile.
"proxy-based"Use a default proxy-based VoIP ALG.
"kernel-helper-based"Use the SIP session helper.
deny-tcp-with-icmpoption
Enable/disable denying TCP by sending an ICMP communication prohibited packet.
"disable"Disable denying TCP with ICMP.
"enable"Deny TCP with ICMP.
devicedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Interface to use for management access for NAT mode.
dhcp-proxyoption
Enable/disable the DHCP Proxy.
"disable"Disable the DHCP proxy.
"enable"Enable the DHCP proxy.
dhcp-proxy-interfacedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Specify outgoing interface to reach server.
dhcp-proxy-interface-select-methodoption
Specify how to select outgoing interface to reach server.
"auto"Set outgoing interface automatically.
"sdwan"Set outgoing interface by SD-WAN or policy routing rules.
"specify"Set outgoing interface manually.
dhcp-server-ipstring array
DHCP Server IPv4 address.
dhcp6-server-ipstring array
DHCPv6 server IPv6 address.
discovered-device-timeoutunsigned int32
Timeout for discovered devices (1 - 365 days, default = 28).
ecmp-max-pathsunsigned int32
Maximum number of Equal Cost Multi-Path (ECMP) next-hops. Set to 1 to disable ECMP routing (1 - 255, default = 255).
email-portal-check-dnsoption
Enable/disable using DNS to validate email addresses collected by a captive portal.
"disable"Disable email address checking with DNS.
"enable"Enable email address checking with DNS.
firewall-session-dirtyoption
Select how to manage sessions affected by firewall policy configuration changes.
"check-all"All sessions affected by a firewall policy change are flushed from the session table. When new packets are recived they are re-evaluated by stateful inspection and re-added to the session table.
"check-new"Estabished sessions for changed firewall policies continue without being affected by the policy configuration change. New sessions are evaluated according to the new firewall policy configuration.
"check-policy-option"Sessions are managed individually depending on the firewall policy. Some sessions may restart. Some may continue.
fw-session-hairpinoption
Enable/disable checking for a matching policy each time hairpin traffic goes through the FortiGate.
"disable"Perform a policy check only the first time the session is received.
"enable"Perform a policy check every time.
gatewayIPv4 address
Transparent mode IPv4 default gateway IP address.
gateway6IPv6 address
Transparent mode IPv4 default gateway IP address.
gtp-asym-fgspoption
Enable/disable GTP asymmetric traffic handling on FGSP.
"disable"Disable GTP asymmetric traffic handling on FGSP.
"enable"Enable GTP asymmetric traffic handling on FGSP.
gtp-monitor-modeoption
Enable/disable GTP monitor mode (VDOM level).
"disable"Disable GTP monitor mode.
"enable"Enable GTP monitor mode.
gui-advanced-policyoption
Enable/disable advanced policy configuration on the GUI.
"disable"Disable advanced policy configuration on the GUI.
"enable"Enable advanced policy configuration on the GUI.
gui-allow-unnamed-policyoption
Enable/disable the requirement for policy naming on the GUI.
"disable"Disable the requirement for policy naming on the GUI.
"enable"Enable the requirement for policy naming on the GUI.
gui-antivirusoption

"disable"Disable AntiVirus on the GUI.
"enable"Enable AntiVirus on the GUI.

"with-space"Format IKE ASN.1 Distinguished Names with spaces between attribute names and values.
"no-space"Format IKE ASN.1 Distinguished Names without spaces between attribute names and values.

"disable"Block link down access traffic.
"enable"Allow link down access traffic.

Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) reception for this VDOM or apply global settings to this VDOM.
"disable"Disable LLDP reception for this VDOM.
"enable"Enable LLDP reception for this VDOM.
"global"Use the global LLDP reception configuration for this VDOM.
lldp-transmissionoption
Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) transmission for this VDOM or apply global settings to this VDOM.
"enable"Enable LLDP transmission for this VDOM.
"disable"Disable LLDP transmission for this VDOM.
"global"Use the global LLDP transmission configuration for this VDOM.
mac-ttlunsigned int32
Duration of MAC addresses in Transparent mode (300 - 8640000 sec, default = 300).
manageipIPv4 array
Transparent mode IPv4 management IP address and netmask.
manageip6IPv6 prefix
Transparent mode IPv6 management IP address and netmask.
motherboard-traffic-forwardingflags
"icmp"
"admin"
multicast-forwardoption
Enable/disable multicast forwarding.
"disable"Disable multicast forwarding.
"enable"Enable multicast forwarding.
multicast-skip-policyoption
Enable/disable allowing multicast traffic through the FortiGate without a policy check.
"disable"Require a multicast policy to allow multicast traffic to pass through the FortiGate.
"enable"Allowing multicast traffic through the FortiGate without creating a multicast firewall policy.
multicast-ttl-notchangeoption
Enable/disable preventing the FortiGate from changing the TTL for forwarded multicast packets.
"disable"The multicast TTL may be changed.
"enable"The multicast TTL is not changed.
ngfw-modeoption
Next Generation Firewall (NGFW) mode.
"profile-based"Application and web-filtering are configured using profiles applied to policy entries.
"policy-based"Application and web-filtering are configured as policy match conditions.
opmodeoption
Firewall operation mode (NAT or Transparent).
"nat"Change to NAT mode.
"transparent"Change to transparent mode.
prp-trailer-actionoption
Enable/disable action to take on PRP trailer.
"disable"Trim PRP trailer.
"enable"Try to keep PRP trailer.
sccp-portunsigned int32
TCP port the SCCP proxy monitors for SCCP traffic (0 - 65535, default = 2000).
sctp-session-without-initoption
Enable/disable SCTP session creation without SCTP INIT.
"disable"Disable SCTP session creation without SCTP INIT.
"enable"Enable SCTP session creation without SCTP INIT.
ses-denied-trafficoption
Enable/disable including denied session in the session table.
"disable"Do not add denied sessions to the session table.
"enable"Include denied sessions in the session table.
sip-expectationoption
Enable/disable the SIP kernel session helper to create an expectation for port 5060.
"disable"Prevent SIP session helper from creating an expectation for port 5060.
"enable"Allow SIP session helper to create an expectation for port 5060.
sip-nat-traceoption
Enable/disable recording the original SIP source IP address when NAT is used.
"disable"Do not record the original SIP source IP address when NAT is used.
"enable"Record the original SIP source IP address when NAT is used.
sip-ssl-portunsigned int32
TCP port the SIP proxy monitors for SIP SSL/TLS traffic (0 - 65535, default = 5061).
sip-tcp-portint array
TCP port the SIP proxy monitors for SIP traffic (0 - 65535, default = 5060).
sip-udp-portint array
UDP port the SIP proxy monitors for SIP traffic (0 - 65535, default = 5060).
snat-hairpin-trafficoption
Enable/disable source NAT (SNAT) for hairpin traffic.
"disable"Disable SNAT for hairpin traffic.
"enable"Enable SNAT for hairpin traffic.
statusoption
Enable/disable this VDOM.
"disable"Disable this VDOM.
"enable"Enable this VDOM.
strict-src-checkoption
Enable/disable strict source verification.
"disable"Disable strict source verification.
"enable"Enable strict source verification.
tcp-session-without-synoption
Enable/disable allowing TCP session without SYN flags.
"disable"Do not allow TCP session without SYN flags.
"enable"Allow TCP session without SYN flags.
utf8-spam-taggingoption
Enable/disable converting antispam tags to UTF-8 for better non-ASCII character support.
"disable"Do not convert antispam tags.
"enable"Convert antispam tags to UTF-8.
v4-ecmp-modeoption
IPv4 Equal-cost multi-path (ECMP) routing and load balancing mode.
"source-ip-based"Select next hop based on source IP.
"weight-based"Select next hop based on weight.
"usage-based"Select next hop based on usage.
"source-dest-ip-based"Select next hop based on both source and destination IPs.
vpn-stats-logflags
Enable/disable periodic VPN log statistics for one or more types of VPN. Separate names with a space.
"ipsec"IPsec.
"pptp"PPTP.
"l2tp"L2TP.
"ssl"SSL.
vpn-stats-periodunsigned int32
Period to send VPN log statistics (0 or 60 - 86400 sec).
wccp-cache-engineoption
Enable/disable WCCP cache engine.
"disable"Disable WCCP cache engine.
"enable"Enable WCCP cache engine.

 

system/sflow (object)

Configure sFlow.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/system/sflow
Attribute ListDescriptions
collector-ipIPv4 address
IP address of the sFlow collector that sFlow agents added to interfaces in this VDOM send sFlow datagrams to (default = 0.0.0.0).
collector-portunsigned int32
UDP port number used for sending sFlow datagrams (configure only if required by your sFlow collector or your network configuration) (0 - 65535, default = 6343).
source-ipIPv4 address
Source IP address for sFlow agent.

"disable"Disable synchronization with NTP server in SMC.
