vpn/ssl/settings (object)

Configure SSL-VPN.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/vpn/ssl/settings
Attribute ListDescriptions
algorithmoption
Force the SSL-VPN security level. High allows only high. Medium allows medium and high. Low allows any.
"default"
"high"High algorithms.
"low"All algorithms.
"medium"High and medium algorithms.
auth-session-check-source-ipoption
Enable/disable checking of source IP for authentication session.
"disable"Disable checking of source IP for authentication session.
"enable"Enable checking of source IP for authentication session.
auth-timeoutunsigned int32
SSL-VPN authentication timeout (1 - 259200 sec (3 days), 0 for no timeout).
authentication-ruletable
auto-tunnel-static-routeoption
Enable/disable to auto-create static routes for the SSL-VPN tunnel IP addresses.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
banned-cipherflags
Select one or more cipher technologies that cannot be used in SSL-VPN negotiations. Only applies to TLS 1.2 and below.
"RSA"Ban the use of cipher suites using RSA key.
"DHE"Ban the use of cipher suites using authenticated ephemeral DH key agreement.
"ECDHE"Ban the use of cipher suites using authenticated ephemeral ECDH key agreement.
"DSS"Ban the use of cipher suites using DSS authentication.
"ECDSA"Ban the use of cipher suites using ECDSA authentication.
"AES"Ban the use of cipher suites using either 128 or 256 bit AES.
"AESGCM"Ban the use of cipher suites AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM).
"CAMELLIA"Ban the use of cipher suites using either 128 or 256 bit CAMELLIA.
"3DES"Ban the use of cipher suites using triple DES
"SHA1"Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA1.
"SHA256"Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA256.
"SHA384"Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA384.
"STATIC"Ban the use of cipher suites using static keys.
check-refereroption
Enable/disable verification of referer field in HTTP request header.
"disable"Disable verification of referer field in HTTP request header.
"enable"Enable verification of referer field in HTTP request header.
default-portaldatasource, refer to vpn ssl web portal (maximum 1)
Default SSL-VPN portal.
deflate-compression-levelunsigned int32
Compression level (0~9).
deflate-min-data-sizeunsigned int32
Minimum amount of data that triggers compression (200 - 65535 bytes).
dns-server1IPv4 address
DNS server 1.
dns-server2IPv4 address
DNS server 2.
dns-suffixstring
DNS suffix used for SSL-VPN clients.
dtls-hello-timeoutunsigned int32
SSLVPN maximum DTLS hello timeout (10 - 60 sec, default = 10).
dtls-max-proto-veroption
DTLS maximum protocol version.
"dtls1-0"DTLS version 1.0.
"dtls1-2"DTLS version 1.2.
dtls-min-proto-veroption
DTLS minimum protocol version.
"dtls1-0"DTLS version 1.0.
"dtls1-2"DTLS version 1.2.
dtls-tunneloption
Enable/disable DTLS to prevent eavesdropping, tampering, or message forgery.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
encode-2f-sequenceoption
Encode \2F sequence to forward slash in URLs.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
encrypt-and-store-passwordoption
Encrypt and store user passwords for SSL-VPN web sessions.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
force-two-factor-authoption
Enable/disable only PKI users with two-factor authentication for SSL-VPNs.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
header-x-forwarded-foroption
Forward the same, add, or remove HTTP header.
"pass"Forward the same HTTP header.
"add"Add the HTTP header.
"remove"Remove the HTTP header.
hsts-include-subdomainsoption
Add HSTS includeSubDomains response header.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
http-compressionoption
Enable/disable to allow HTTP compression over SSL-VPN tunnels.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
http-only-cookieoption
Enable/disable SSL-VPN support for HttpOnly cookies.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
http-request-body-timeoutunsigned int32
SSL-VPN session is disconnected if an HTTP request body is not received within this time (1 - 60 sec, default = 20).
http-request-header-timeoutunsigned int32
SSL-VPN session is disconnected if an HTTP request header is not received within this time (1 - 60 sec, default = 20).
https-redirectoption
Enable/disable redirect of port 80 to SSL-VPN port.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
idle-timeoutunsigned int32
SSL-VPN disconnects if idle for specified time in seconds.
ipv6-dns-server1IPv6 address
IPv6 DNS server 1.
ipv6-dns-server2IPv6 address
IPv6 DNS server 2.
ipv6-wins-server1IPv6 address
IPv6 WINS server 1.
ipv6-wins-server2IPv6 address
IPv6 WINS server 2.
login-attempt-limitunsigned int32
SSL-VPN maximum login attempt times before block (0 - 10, default = 2, 0 = no limit).
login-block-timeunsigned int32
Time for which a user is blocked from logging in after too many failed login attempts (0 - 86400 sec, default = 60).
login-timeoutunsigned int32
SSLVPN maximum login timeout (10 - 180 sec, default = 30).
portunsigned int32
SSL-VPN access port (1 - 65535).
port-precedenceoption
Enable/disable, Enable means that if SSL-VPN connections are allowed on an interface admin GUI connections are blocked on that interface.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
reqclientcertoption
Enable/disable to require client certificates for all SSL-VPN users.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
servercertdatasource, refer to vpn certificate local, or certificate local (maximum 1)
Name of the server certificate to be used for SSL-VPNs.
source-addressdatasource, refer to firewall address, firewall addrgrp, or system external-resource (maximum 256)
Source address of incoming traffic.
source-address-negateoption
Enable/disable negated source address match.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
source-address6datasource, refer to firewall address6, firewall addrgrp6, or system external-resource (maximum 256)
IPv6 source address of incoming traffic.
source-address6-negateoption
Enable/disable negated source IPv6 address match.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
source-interfacedatasource, refer to system interface, or system zone (maximum 256)
SSL-VPN source interface of incoming traffic.
ssl-client-renegotiationoption
Enable/disable to allow client renegotiation by the server if the tunnel goes down.
"disable"Abort any SSL connection that attempts to renegotiate.
"enable"Allow a SSL client to renegotiate.
ssl-insert-empty-fragmentoption
Enable/disable insertion of empty fragment.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
ssl-max-proto-veroption
SSL maximum protocol version.
"tls1-0"TLS version 1.0.
"tls1-1"TLS version 1.1.
"tls1-2"TLS version 1.2.
"tls1-3"TLS version 1.3.
ssl-min-proto-veroption
SSL minimum protocol version.
"tls1-0"TLS version 1.0.
"tls1-1"TLS version 1.1.
"tls1-2"TLS version 1.2.
"tls1-3"TLS version 1.3.
transform-backward-slashesoption
Transform backward slashes to forward slashes in URLs.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
tunnel-connect-without-reauthoption
Enable/disable tunnel connection without re-authorization if previous connection dropped.
"disable"Disable tunnel connection without re-authorization.
"enable"Enable tunnel connection without re-authorization.
tunnel-ip-poolsdatasource, refer to firewall address, or firewall addrgrp (maximum 256)
Names of the IPv4 IP Pool firewall objects that define the IP addresses reserved for remote clients.
tunnel-ipv6-poolsdatasource, refer to firewall address6, or firewall addrgrp6 (maximum 256)
Names of the IPv6 IP Pool firewall objects that define the IP addresses reserved for remote clients.
tunnel-user-session-timeoutunsigned int32
Time out value to clean up user session after tunnel connection is dropped (1 - 255 sec, default=30).
unsafe-legacy-renegotiationoption
Enable/disable unsafe legacy re-negotiation.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
url-obscurationoption
Enable/disable to obscure the host name of the URL of the web browser display.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
user-peerdatasource, refer to user peer (maximum 1)
Name of user peer.
wins-server1IPv4 address
WINS server 1.
wins-server2IPv4 address
WINS server 2.
x-content-type-optionsoption
Add HTTP X-Content-Type-Options header.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.

"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.

"disable"Disable SSO.
"static"Static SSO.
"auto"Auto SSO.

"alternative"Alternative.

"disable"Single sign-on credentials are sent to remote server for every HTTP request.
"enable"Single sign-on credentials are only sent once to remote server.

sso-usernamestring

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:

Attribute ListDescriptions
bookmarkstable
namedatasource, refer to user group (maximum 1), master key
Group name.

"enable"Enable setting.

"alternative"Alternative.

"disable"Single sign-on credentials are sent to remote server for every HTTP request.
"enable"Single sign-on credentials are only sent once to remote server.
sso-passwordpassword
SSO password.
sso-usernamestring
SSO user name.
urlstring
URL parameter.

wanopt/cache-service (object)

Designate cache-service for wan-optimization and webcache.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/wanopt/cache-service
Attribute ListDescriptions
acceptable-connectionsoption
Set strategy when accepting cache collaboration connection.
"any"We can accept any cache-collaboration connection.
"peers"We can only accept connections that are already in src-peers.
collaborationoption
Enable/disable cache-collaboration between cache-service clusters.
"disable"Disable cache cache-collaboration.
"enable"Enable cache cache-collaboration.
device-idstring
Set identifier for this cache device.
dst-peertable
prefer-scenariooption
Set the preferred cache behavior towards the balance between latency and hit-ratio.
"balance"Balance between speed and cache hit ratio.
"prefer-speed"Prefer response speed at the expense of increased cache bypasses.
"prefer-cache"Prefer improving hit-ratio through increasing latency tolerance.
src-peertable

ID that this device uses to connect to the remote device.

ID of the remote device to which the device connects.
remote-cache-ipIPv4 address
IP address of the remote device to which the device connects.
statusoption
Enable/disable using remote device as Web cache storage.
"disable"Use local disks as Web cache storage.
"enable"Use a remote device as Web cache storage.

 

wanopt/settings (object)

Configure WAN optimization settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wanopt/settings
Attribute ListDescriptions
auto-detect-algorithmoption
Auto detection algorithms used in tunnel negotiations.
"simple"Use the same TCP option value in SYN/SYNACK packets. Backward compatible.
"diff-req-resp"Use different TCP option values in SYN/SYNACK packets to avoid false positive detection.
host-idstring
Local host ID (must also be entered in the remote FortiGate's peer list).
tunnel-ssl-algorithmoption
Relative strength of encryption algorithms accepted during tunnel negotiation.
"high"High encryption. Allow only AES and ChaCha.
"medium"Medium encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, and RC4.
"low"Low encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, RC4, and DES.

 

wanopt/webcache (object)

Configure global Web cache settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wanopt/webcache
Attribute ListDescriptions
always-revalidateoption
Enable/disable revalidation of requested cached objects, which have content on the server, before serving it to the client.
"disable"Disable revalidation of requested cached objects.
"enable"Enable revalidation of requested cached objects.
cache-by-defaultoption
Enable/disable caching content that lacks explicit caching policies from the server.
"disable"Disable caching content that lacks explicit caching policies.
"enable"Enable caching content that lacks explicit caching policies.
cache-cookieoption
Enable/disable caching cookies. Since cookies contain information for or about individual users, they not usually cached.
"disable"Do not cache cookies.
"enable"Cache cookies.
cache-expiredoption
Enable/disable caching type-1 objects that are already expired on arrival.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
default-ttlunsigned int32
Default object expiry time (default = 1440 min (1 day); maximum = 5256000 min (10 years)). This only applies to those objects that do not have an expiry time set by the web server.
externaloption
Enable/disable external Web caching.
"disable"Disable external Web caching.
"enable"Enable external Web caching.
fresh-factorunsigned int32
Frequency that the server is checked to see if any objects have expired (1 - 100, default = 100). The higher the fresh factor, the less often the checks occur.
host-validateoption
Enable/disable validating "Host:" with original server IP.
"disable"Disable validating "Host:" with original server IP.
"enable"Enable validating "Host:" with original server IP.
ignore-conditionaloption
Enable/disable controlling the behavior of cache-control HTTP 1.1 header values.
"disable"Disable ignoring cache-control HTTP 1.1 header values.
"enable"Enable ignoring cache-control HTTP 1.1 header values.
ignore-ie-reloadoption
Enable/disable ignoring the PNC-interpretation of Internet Explorer's Accept: / header.
"disable"Disable Enable/disable ignoring the PNC-interpretation of Internet Explorer's Accept: / header.
"enable"Enable Enable/disable ignoring the PNC-interpretation of Internet Explorer's Accept: / header.
ignore-imsoption
Enable/disable ignoring the if-modified-since (IMS) header.
"disable"Disable ignoring the if-modified-since (IMS) header.
"enable"Enable ignoring the if-modified-since (IMS) header.
ignore-pncoption
Enable/disable ignoring the pragma no-cache (PNC) header.
"disable"Disable ignoring the pragma no-cache (PNC) header.
"enable"Enable ignoring the pragma no-cache (PNC) header.
max-object-sizeunsigned int32
Maximum cacheable object size in kB (1 - 2147483 kb (2GB). All objects that exceed this are delivered to the client but not stored in the web cache.
max-ttlunsigned int32
Maximum time an object can stay in the web cache without checking to see if it has expired on the server (default = 7200 min (5 days); maximum = 5256000 min (10 years)).
min-ttlunsigned int32
Minimum time an object can stay in the web cache without checking to see if it has expired on the server (default = 5 min; maximum = 5256000 (10 years)).
neg-resp-timeunsigned int32
Time in minutes to cache negative responses or errors (0 - 4294967295, default = 0 which means negative responses are not cached).
reval-pncoption
Enable/disable revalidation of pragma-no-cache (PNC) to address bandwidth concerns.
"disable"Disable revalidation of pragma-no-cache (PNC).
"enable"Enable revalidation of pragma-no-cache (PNC).

web-proxy/explicit (object)

Configure explicit Web proxy settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/web-proxy/explicit
Attribute ListDescriptions
ftp-incoming-portdest/src port range array
Accept incoming FTP-over-HTTP requests on one or more ports (0 - 65535, default = 0; use the same as HTTP).
ftp-over-httpoption
Enable to proxy FTP-over-HTTP sessions sent from a web browser.
"disable"Disable FTP-over-HTTP sessions.
"enable"Enable FTP-over-HTTP sessions.
http-incoming-portdest/src port range array
Accept incoming HTTP requests on one or more ports (0 - 65535, default = 8080).
https-incoming-portdest/src port range array
Accept incoming HTTPS requests on one or more ports (0 - 65535, default = 0, use the same as HTTP).
https-replacement-messageoption
Enable/disable sending the client a replacement message for HTTPS requests.
"disable"Do not display a replacement message for HTTPS requests.
"enable"Display a replacement message for HTTPS requests.
incoming-ipIPv4 address
Restrict the explicit HTTP proxy to only accept sessions from this IP address. An interface must have this IP address.
incoming-ip6IPv6 address
Restrict the explicit web proxy to only accept sessions from this IPv6 address. An interface must have this IPv6 address.
ipv6-statusoption
Enable/disable allowing an IPv6 web proxy destination in policies and all IPv6 related entries in this command.
"disable"Disable allowing an IPv6 web proxy destination.
"enable"Enable allowing an IPv6 web proxy destination.
message-upon-server-erroroption
Enable/disable displaying a replacement message when a server error is detected.
"disable"Do not display a replacement message when a server error is detected.
"enable"Display a replacement message when a server error is detected.
outgoing-ipIPv4 address array
Outgoing HTTP requests will have this IP address as their source address. An interface must have this IP address.
outgoing-ip6IPv6 address array
Outgoing HTTP requests will leave this IPv6. Multiple interfaces can be specified. Interfaces must have these IPv6 addresses.
pac-file-datastring
PAC file contents enclosed in quotes (maximum of 256K bytes).
pac-file-namestring
Pac file name.
pac-file-server-portdest/src port range array
Port number that PAC traffic from client web browsers uses to connect to the explicit web proxy (0 - 65535, default = 0; use the same as HTTP).
pac-file-server-statusoption
Enable/disable Proxy Auto-Configuration (PAC) for users of this explicit proxy profile.
"disable"Disable Proxy Auto-Configuration (PAC).
"enable"Enable Proxy Auto-Configuration (PAC).
pac-file-urlstring
pac-policytable
pref-dns-resultoption
Prefer resolving addresses using the configured IPv4 or IPv6 DNS server (default = ipv4).
"ipv4"Prefer the IPv4 DNS server.
"ipv6"Prefer the IPv6 DNS server.
realmstring
Authentication realm used to identify the explicit web proxy (maximum of 63 characters).
sec-default-actionoption
Accept or deny explicit web proxy sessions when no web proxy firewall policy exists.
"deny"Deny requests unless there is a matching explicit web proxy policy.
"accept"Accept requests. All explicit web proxy traffic is accepted whether there is an explicit web proxy policy or not.
socksoption
Enable/disable the SOCKS proxy.
"disable"Disable the SOCKS proxy.
"enable"Enable the SOCKS proxy.
socks-incoming-portdest/src port range array
Accept incoming SOCKS proxy requests on one or more ports (0 - 65535, default = 0; use the same as HTTP).
ssl-algorithmoption
Relative strength of encryption algorithms accepted in HTTPS deep scan: high, medium, or low.
"high"High encrption. Allow only AES and ChaCha.
"medium"Medium encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, and RC4.
"low"Low encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, RC4, and DES.
statusoption
Enable/disable the explicit Web proxy for HTTP and HTTPS session.
"disable"Disable the explicit web proxy.
"enable"Enable the explicit web proxy.
strict-guestoption
Enable/disable strict guest user checking by the explicit web proxy.
"disable"Disable strict guest user checking.
"enable"Enable strict guest user checking.
trace-auth-no-rspoption
Enable/disable logging timed-out authentication requests.
"disable"Disable logging timed-out authentication requests.
"enable"Enable logging timed-out authentication requests.
unknown-http-versionoption
How to handle HTTP sessions that do not comply with HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1.
"best-effort"Assume all HTTP sessions comply with HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1. If a session uses a different HTTP version, it may not parse correctly and the connection may be lost.
"reject"Reject or tear down HTTP sessions that do not use HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1.
"tunnel"Pass HTTP traffic that does not use HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1 without applying HTTP protocol optimization, byte-caching, or web caching. TCP protocol optimization is applied.

web-proxy/global (object)

Configure Web proxy global settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/web-proxy/global
Attribute ListDescriptions
fast-policy-matchoption
Enable/disable fast matching algorithm for explicit and transparent proxy policy.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
forward-proxy-authoption
Enable/disable forwarding proxy authentication headers.
"disable"Disable forwarding proxy authentication headers.
"enable"Enable forwarding proxy authentication headers.
forward-server-affinity-timeoutunsigned int32
Period of time before the source IP's traffic is no longer assigned to the forwarding server (6 - 60 min, default = 30).
learn-client-ipoption
Enable/disable learning the client's IP address from headers.
"disable"Disable learning the client's IP address from headers.
"enable"Enable learning the client's IP address from headers.
learn-client-ip-from-headerflags
Learn client IP address from the specified headers.
"true-client-ip"Learn the client IP address from the True-Client-IP header.
"x-real-ip"Learn the client IP address from the X-Real-IP header.
"x-forwarded-for"Learn the client IP address from the X-Forwarded-For header.
learn-client-ip-srcaddrdatasource, refer to firewall address, or firewall addrgrp (maximum 256)
Source address name (srcaddr or srcaddr6 must be set).
learn-client-ip-srcaddr6datasource, refer to firewall address6, or firewall addrgrp6 (maximum 256)
IPv6 Source address name (srcaddr or srcaddr6 must be set).
max-message-lengthunsigned int32
Maximum length of HTTP message, not including body (16 - 256 Kbytes, default = 32).
max-request-lengthunsigned int32
Maximum length of HTTP request line (2 - 64 Kbytes, default = 8).
max-waf-body-cache-lengthunsigned int32
Maximum length of HTTP messages processed by Web Application Firewall (WAF) (10 - 1024 Kbytes, default = 32).
proxy-fqdnstring
Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) that clients connect to (default = default.fqdn) to connect to the explicit web proxy.
ssl-ca-certdatasource, refer to vpn certificate local, or certificate local (maximum 1)
SSL CA certificate for SSL interception.
ssl-certdatasource, refer to vpn certificate local, or certificate local (maximum 1)
SSL certificate for SSL interception.
strict-web-checkoption
Enable/disable strict web checking to block web sites that send incorrect headers that don't conform to HTTP 1.1.
"disable"Disable strict web checking.
"enable"Enable strict web checking.
webproxy-profiledatasource, refer to web-proxy profile (maximum 1)
Name of the web proxy profile to apply when explicit proxy traffic is allowed by default and traffic is accepted that does not match an explicit proxy policy.

 

web-proxy/url-match (table)

Exempt URLs from web proxy forwarding and caching.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/web-proxy/url-match
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/web-proxy/url-match/<url-match_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
cache-exemptionoption
Enable/disable exempting this URL pattern from caching.
"disable"Disable exempting this URL pattern from caching.
"enable"Enable exempting this URL pattern from caching.
commentstring
Comment.
forward-serverdatasource, refer to web-proxy forward-server, or web-proxy forward-server-group (maximum 1)
Forward server name.
namestring, master key
Configure a name for the URL to be exempted.
statusoption
Enable/disable exempting the URLs matching the URL pattern from web proxy forwarding and caching.
"disable"Disable exempting the matching URLs.
"enable"Enable exempting the matching URLs.
url-patternstring
URL pattern to be exempted from web proxy forwarding and caching.

 

webfilter/fortiguard (object)

Configure FortiGuard Web Filter service.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/webfilter/fortiguard
Attribute ListDescriptions
cache-mem-percentunsigned int16
Maximum percentage of available memory allocated to caching (1 - 15%).
cache-modeoption
Cache entry expiration mode.
"ttl"Expire cache items by time-to-live.
"db-ver"Expire cache items when the server DB version changes.
cache-prefix-matchoption
Enable/disable prefix matching in the cache.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
close-portsoption
Close ports used for HTTP/HTTPS override authentication and disable user overrides.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
ovrd-auth-httpsoption
Enable/disable use of HTTPS for override authentication.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.
ovrd-auth-port-httpunsigned int16
Port to use for FortiGuard Web Filter HTTP override authentication
ovrd-auth-port-httpsunsigned int16
Port to use for FortiGuard Web Filter HTTPS override authentication in proxy mode.
ovrd-auth-port-https-flowunsigned int32
Port to use for FortiGuard Web Filter HTTPS override authentication in flow mode.
ovrd-auth-port-warningunsigned int32
Port to use for FortiGuard Web Filter Warning override authentication.
request-packet-size-limitunsigned int32
Limit size of URL request packets sent to FortiGuard server (0 for default).
warn-auth-httpsoption
Enable/disable use of HTTPS for warning and authentication.
"disable"Disable setting.
"enable"Enable setting.

 

webfilter/ips-urlfilter-cache-setting (object)

Configure IPS URL filter cache settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/webfilter/ips-urlfilter-cache-setting
Attribute ListDescriptions
dns-retry-intervalunsigned int32
Retry interval. Refresh DNS faster than TTL to capture multiple IPs for hosts. 0 means use DNS server's TTL only.
extended-ttlunsigned int32
Extend time to live beyond reported by DNS. 0 means use DNS server's TTL

 

webfilter/ips-urlfilter-setting (object)

Configure IPS URL filter settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/webfilter/ips-urlfilter-setting
Attribute ListDescriptions
devicedatasource, refer to system interface (maximum 1)
Interface for this route.
distanceunsigned int32
Administrative distance (1 - 255) for this route.
gatewayIPv4 address
Gateway IP address for this route.
geo-filterstring
Filter based on geographical location. Route will NOT be installed if the resolved IP address belongs to the country in the filter.

distanceunsigned int32
Administrative distance (1 - 255) for this route.
gateway6IPv6 address
Gateway IPv6 address for this route.
geo-filterstring

webfilter/override (table)

Configure FortiGuard Web Filter administrative overrides.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/webfilter/override
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/webfilter/override/<override_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
expiresdate time
Override expiration date and time, from 5 minutes to 365 from now (format: yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss).
idsequence, master key
Override rule ID.
initiatorstring
Initiating user of override (read-only setting).
ipIPv4 address
IPv4 address which the override applies.
ip6IPv6 address
IPv6 address which the override applies.
new-profiledatasource, refer to webfilter profile (maximum 1)
Name of the new web filter profile used by the override.
old-profiledatasource, refer to webfilter profile (maximum 1)
Name of the web filter profile which the override applies.
scopeoption
Override either the specific user, user group, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address.
"user"Override the specified user.
"user-group"Override the specified user group.
"ip"Override the specified IP address.
"ip6"Override the specified IPv6 address.
statusoption
Enable/disable override rule.
"disable"Disable override rule.
"enable"Enable override rule.
userdatasource, refer to user local
Name of the user which the override applies.
user-groupdatasource, refer to user group (maximum 1)
Specify the user group for which the override applies.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Attribute ListDescriptions
charsetoption
Search engine charset.
"utf-8"UTF-8 encoding.
"gb2312"GB2312 encoding.
hostnamestring
Hostname (regular expression).
namestring, master key
Search engine name.
querystring
Code used to prefix a query (must end with an equals character).
safesearchoption
Safe search method. You can disable safe search, add the safe search string to URLs, or insert a safe search header.
"disable"Site does not support safe search.
"url"Safe search selected with a parameter in the URL.
"header"Safe search selected by search header (i.e. youtube.edu).
safesearch-strstring
Safe search parameter used in the URL.
urlstring
URL (regular expression).

actionoption
Policy action (allow | deny).
"allow"Allows traffic matching the policy.
"deny"Blocks traffic matching the policy.
commentstring
Description.
dstaddrstring
Destination IP address (any | local-LAN | IPv4 address[/<network mask | mask length>], default = any).
dstportunsigned int32
Destination port (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning any).
protocolunsigned int32
Protocol type as defined by IANA (0 - 255, default = 255, meaning any).
rule-idunsigned int32, master key
Rule ID (1 - 65535).
srcaddrstring
Source IP address (any | local-LAN | IPv4 address[/<network mask | mask length>], default = any).
srcportunsigned int32
Source port (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning any).

Attribute ListDescriptions
ac-ipIPv4 address
IP address of the validation controller that AP must be able to join after applying AP local configuration.
ac-portunsigned int32
Port of the validation controller that AP must be able to join after applying AP local configuration (1024 - 49150, default = 5246).
ac-timerunsigned int32
Maximum waiting time for the AP to join the validation controller after applying AP local configuration (3 - 30 min, default = 10).
ac-typeoption
Validation controller type (default = default).
"default"This controller is the one and only controller that the AP could join after applying AP local configuration.
"specify"Specified controller is the one and only controller that the AP could join after applying AP local configuration.
"apcfg"Any controller defined by AP local configuration after applying AP local configuration.
command-listtable
commentstring
Comment.
namestring, master key

wireless-controller/arrp-profile (table)

Configure WiFi Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (ARRP) profiles.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/arrp-profile
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/arrp-profile/<arrp-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
include-dfs-channeloption
Enable/disable use of DFS channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 (default = disable).
"no"
"yes"
include-weather-channeloption
Enable/disable use of weather channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 (default = disable).
"no"
"yes"
monitor-periodunsigned int32
Period in seconds to measure average transmit retries and receive errors (default = 300).
namestring, master key
WiFi ARRP profile name.
selection-periodunsigned int32
Period in seconds to measure average channel load, noise floor, spectral RSSI (default = 3600).
threshold-apunsigned int32
Threshold to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to surrounding APs (0 - 500, default = 250).
threshold-channel-loadunsigned int32
Threshold in percentage to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to channel load (0 - 100, default = 60).
threshold-noise-floorstring
Threshold in dBm to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to noise floor (-95 to -20, default = -85).
threshold-rx-errorsunsigned int32
Threshold in percentage for receive errors to trigger channel reselection in DARRP monitor stage (0 - 100, default = 50).
threshold-spectral-rssistring
Threshold in dBm to reject channel in DARRP channel selection phase 1 due to spectral RSSI (-95 to -20, default = -65).
threshold-tx-retriesunsigned int32
Threshold in percentage for transmit retries to trigger channel reselection in DARRP monitor stage (0 - 1000, default = 300).
weight-channel-loadunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for channel load (0 - 2000, default = 20).
weight-dfs-channelunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for DFS channel (0 - 2000, default = 500).
weight-managed-apunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for managed APs (0 - 2000, default = 50).
weight-noise-floorunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for noise floor (0 - 2000, default = 40).
weight-rogue-apunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for rogue APs (0 - 2000, default = 10).
weight-spectral-rssiunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for spectral RSSI (0 - 2000, default = 40).
weight-weather-channelunsigned int32
Weight in DARRP channel score calculation for weather channel (0 - 2000, default = 1000).

Configure Bonjour profiles. Bonjour is Apple's zero configuration networking protocol. Bonjour profiles allow APs and FortiAPs to connnect to networks using Bonjour.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile

Attribute ListDescriptions

Comment.
namestring, master key
Bonjour profile name.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, move, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile/<bonjour-profile_name>/policy-list
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/bonjour-profile/<bonjour-profile_name>/policy-list/<policy-list_policy-id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
descriptionstring
Description.
from-vlanstring
VLAN ID from which the Bonjour service is advertised (0 - 4094, default = 0).
policy-idunsigned int32, master key
Policy ID.
servicesflags
Bonjour services for the VLAN connecting to the Bonjour network.
"airplay"AirPlay.
"afp"AFP (Apple File Sharing).
"bit-torrent"BitTorrent.
"ftp"FTP.
"ichat"iChat.
"itunes"iTunes.
"printers"Printers.
"samba"Samba.
"scanners"Scanners.
"ssh"SSH.
"chromecast"ChromeCast.
"all"All services.
to-vlanstring
VLAN ID to which the Bonjour service is made available (0 - 4094, default = all).

 

wireless-controller/global (object)

Configure wireless controller global settings.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/wireless-controller/global
Attribute ListDescriptions
ap-log-serveroption
Enable/disable configuring APs or FortiAPs to send log messages to a syslog server (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP log server.
"enable"Enable AP log server.
ap-log-server-ipIPv4 address
IP address that APs or FortiAPs send log messages to.
ap-log-server-portunsigned int32
Port that APs or FortiAPs send log messages to.
control-message-offloadflags
Configure CAPWAP control message data channel offload.
"ebp-frame"Ekahau blink protocol (EBP) frames.
"aeroscout-tag"AeroScout tag.
"ap-list"Rogue AP list.
"sta-list"Rogue STA list.
"sta-cap-list"STA capability list.
"stats"WTP, radio, VAP, and STA statistics.
"aeroscout-mu"AeroScout Mobile Unit (MU) report.
"sta-health"STA health log.
"spectral-analysis"Spectral analysis report.
data-ethernet-IIoption
Configure the wireless controller to use Ethernet II or 802.3 frames with 802.3 data tunnel mode (default = enable).
"disable"Use 802.3 Ethernet frames with 802.3 data tunnel mode.
"enable"Use Ethernet II frames with 802.3 data tunnel mode.
discovery-mc-addrIPv4 address
Multicast IP address for AP discovery (default = 244.0.1.140).
fiapp-eth-typeunsigned int32
Ethernet type for Fortinet Inter-Access Point Protocol (IAPP), or IEEE 802.11f, packets (0 - 65535, default = 5252).
image-downloadoption
Enable/disable WTP image download at join time.
"disable"Disable WTP image download at join time.
"enable"Enable WTP image download at join time.
ipsec-base-ipIPv4 address
Base IP address for IPsec VPN tunnels between the access points and the wireless controller (default = 169.254.0.1).
link-aggregationoption
Enable/disable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash to load balance sessions to link aggregation nodes (default = disable).
"disable"Disable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash.
"enable"Enable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash.
local-radio-vdomdatasource, refer to system vdom (maximum 1)
Assign local radio's virtual domain.
locationstring
Description of the location of the wireless controller.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
max-retransmitunsigned int32
Maximum number of tunnel packet retransmissions (0 - 64, default = 3).
mesh-eth-typeunsigned int32
Mesh Ethernet identifier included in backhaul packets (0 - 65535, default = 8755).
namestring
Name of the wireless controller.
rogue-scan-mac-adjacencyunsigned int32
Maximum numerical difference between an AP's Ethernet and wireless MAC values to match for rogue detection (0 - 31, default = 7).
wtp-shareoption
Enable/disable sharing of WTPs between VDOMs.
"disable"WTP can be used only in its own VDOM.
"enable"WTP can be shared between all VDOMs.

Configure connection capability.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/hotspot20/h2qp-conn-capability
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/hotspot20/h2qp-conn-capability/<h2qp-conn-capability_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
esp-portoption
Set ESP port service (used by IPsec VPNs) status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ftp-portoption
Set FTP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
http-portoption
Set HTTP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
icmp-portoption
Set ICMP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ikev2-portoption
Set IKEv2 port service for IPsec VPN status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ikev2-xx-portoption
Set UDP port 4500 (which may be used by IKEv2 for IPsec VPN) service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
namestring, master key
Connection capability name.
pptp-vpn-portoption
Set Point to Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) VPN port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
ssh-portoption
Set SSH port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
tls-portoption
Set TLS VPN (HTTPS) port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
voip-tcp-portoption
Set VoIP TCP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.
voip-udp-portoption
Set VoIP UDP port service status.
"closed"The port is not open for communication.
"open"The port is open for communication.
"unknown"The port may or may not be open for communication.

wireless-controller/inter-controller (object)

Configure inter wireless controller operation.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/wireless-controller/inter-controller
Attribute ListDescriptions
fast-failover-maxunsigned int32
Maximum number of retransmissions for fast failover HA messages between peer wireless controllers (3 - 64, default = 10).
fast-failover-waitunsigned int32
Minimum wait time before an AP transitions from secondary controller to primary controller (10 - 86400 sec, default = 10).
inter-controller-keypassword
Secret key for inter-controller communications.
inter-controller-modeoption
Configure inter-controller mode (disable, l2-roaming, 1+1, default = disable).
"disable"Disable inter-controller mode.
"l2-roaming"Enable layer 2 roaming support between inter-controllers.
"1+1"Enable 1+1 fast failover mode.
inter-controller-peertable
inter-controller-prioption
Configure inter-controller's priority (primary or secondary, default = primary).
"primary"Primary fast failover mode.
"secondary"Secondary fast failover mode.

 

wireless-controller/inter-controller/inter-controller-peer (table)

Fast failover peer wireless controller list.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/wireless-controller/inter-controller/inter-controller-peer
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/wireless-controller/inter-controller/inter-controller-peer/<inter-controller-peer_id>
Attribute ListDescriptions
idsequence, master key
ID.
peer-ipIPv4 address
Peer wireless controller's IP address.
peer-portunsigned int32
Port used by the wireless controller's for inter-controller communications (1024 - 49150, default = 5246).
peer-priorityoption
Peer wireless controller's priority (primary or secondary, default = primary).
"primary"Primary fast failover mode.
"secondary"Secondary fast failover mode.

 

wireless-controller/log (object)

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/log
Attribute ListDescriptions
addrgrp-logoption
Lowest severity level to log address group message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
ble-logoption
Lowest severity level to log BLE detection message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
clb-logoption
Lowest severity level to log client load balancing message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
dhcp-starv-logoption
Lowest severity level to log DHCP starvation event message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
led-sched-logoption
Lowest severity level to log LED schedule event message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
radio-event-logoption
Lowest severity level to log radio event message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
rogue-event-logoption
Lowest severity level to log rogue AP event message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.

"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.

"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.
statusoption
Enable/disable wireless event logging.
"disable"Disable wireless event logging.
"enable"Enable wireless event logging.
wids-logoption
Lowest severity level to log WIDS message.
"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.
"information"Information level.
"debug"Debug level.

"emergency"Emergency level.
"alert"Alert level.
"critical"Critical level.
"error"Error level.
"warning"Warning level.
"notification"Notification level.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/mpsk-profile
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/mpsk-profile/<mpsk-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
mpsk-concurrent-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of concurrent clients that connect using the same passphrase in multiple PSK authentication (0 - 65535, default = 0, meaning no limitation).
mpsk-grouptable
namestring, master key
MPSK profile name.
ssidstring
SSID of the VAP in which the MPSK profile is configured.

Attribute ListDescriptions
commentstring
Comment.
concurrent-client-limit-typeoption
MPSK client limit type options.
"default"Using the value in profile configuration.
"unlimited"Unlimited.
"specified"Specified value.
concurrent-clientsunsigned int32
Number of clients that can connect using this pre-shared key (1 - 65535, default is 256).
macmac address
MAC address.
mpsk-schedulesdatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule onetime, or firewall schedule recurring (maximum 16)
Firewall schedule for MPSK passphrase. The passphrase will be effective only when at least one schedule is valid.
namestring, master key
Pre-shared key name.
passphrasepassword
WPA Pre-shared key.
pmkpassword
WPA PMK.

 

wireless-controller/qos-profile (table)

Configure WiFi quality of service (QoS) profiles.

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/qos-profile
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/qos-profile/<qos-profile_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
bandwidth-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"disable"Disable WMM bandwidth admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM bandwidth admission control.
bandwidth-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).
burstoption
Enable/disable client rate burst.
"disable"Disable client rate burst.
"enable"Enable client rate burst.
call-admission-controloption
Enable/disable WMM call admission control.
"disable"Disable WMM call admission control.
"enable"Enable WMM call admission control.
call-capacityunsigned int32
Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones allowed (0 - 60, default = 10).
commentstring
Comment.
downlinkunsigned int32
Maximum downlink bandwidth for Virtual Access Points (VAPs) (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
downlink-staunsigned int32
Maximum downlink bandwidth for clients (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
dscp-wmm-beint array
DSCP mapping for best effort access (default = 0 24).
dscp-wmm-bkint array
DSCP mapping for background access (default = 8 16).
dscp-wmm-mappingoption
Enable/disable Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) mapping.
"disable"Disable Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) mapping.
"enable"Enable Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) mapping.
dscp-wmm-viint array
DSCP mapping for video access (default = 32 40).
dscp-wmm-voint array
DSCP mapping for voice access (default = 48 56).
namestring, master key
WiFi QoS profile name.
uplinkunsigned int32
Maximum uplink bandwidth for Virtual Access Points (VAPs) (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
uplink-staunsigned int32
Maximum uplink bandwidth for clients (0 - 2097152 Kbps, default = 0, 0 means no limit).
wmmoption
Enable/disable WiFi multi-media (WMM) control.
"disable"Disable WiFi multi-media (WMM) control.
"enable"Enable WiFi multi-media (WMM) control.
wmm-be-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for best effort access (default = 0).
wmm-bk-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for background access (default = 8).
wmm-dscp-markingoption
Enable/disable WMM Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) marking.
"disable"Disable WMM Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) marking.
"enable"Enable WMM Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) marking.
wmm-uapsdoption
Enable/disable WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD) power save mode.
"disable"Disable WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD) power save mode.
"enable"Enable WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD) power save mode.
wmm-vi-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for video access (default = 32).
wmm-vo-dscpunsigned int32
DSCP marking for voice access (default = 48).

Time for running Dynamic Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) optimizations (0 - 86400 sec, default = 86400, 0 = disable).
darrp-optimize-schedulesdatasource, refer to firewall schedule recurring, firewall schedule group, or firewall schedule onetime (maximum 16)
Firewall schedules for DARRP running time. DARRP will run periodically based on darrp-optimize within the schedules. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
device-holdoffunsigned int32
Lower limit of creation time of device for identification in minutes (0 - 60, default = 5).
device-idleunsigned int32
Upper limit of idle time of device for identification in minutes (0 - 14400, default = 1440).
device-weightunsigned int32
Upper limit of confidence of device for identification (0 - 255, default = 1, 0 = disable).

Enable/disable allowing Virtual Access Points (VAPs) to use the same SSID name in the same VDOM.
"disable"Do not allow VAPs to use the same SSID name in the same VDOM.
"enable"Allow VAPs to use the same SSID name in the same VDOM.

"log"Write logs for detected fake SSID.
"suppress"Suppress detected fake SSID.

"disable"Disable FAP-C series compatibility.
"enable"Enable FAP-C series compatibility.

"enable"Enable phishing SSID detection.
wfa-compatibilityoption
Enable/disable WFA compatibility.
"disable"Disable Wi-Fi Alliance Certification compatibility.
"enable"Enable Wi-Fi Alliance Certification compatibility.

"md5"HMAC-MD5-96 authentication protocol.
"sha"HMAC-SHA-96 authentication protocol.

Password for authentication protocol.

SNMP User Name

Configure SNMP User Notify Hosts.

"enable"Enable setting.

"no-auth-no-priv"Message with no authentication and no privacy (encryption).

wireless-controller/timers (object)

Configure CAPWAP timers.

Supported methods: get, set, update

Object URL:
Table object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/global/wireless-controller/timers
Attribute ListDescriptions
ble-scan-report-intvunsigned int32
Time between running Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) reports (10 - 3600 sec, default = 30).
client-idle-timeoutunsigned int32
Time after which a client is considered idle and times out (20 - 3600 sec, default = 300, 0 for no timeout).
discovery-intervalunsigned int32
Time between discovery requests (2 - 180 sec, default = 5).
echo-intervalunsigned int32
Time between echo requests sent by the managed WTP, AP, or FortiAP (1 - 255 sec, default = 30).
fake-ap-logunsigned int32
Time between recording logs about fake APs if periodic fake AP logging is configured (0 - 1440 min, default = 1).
ipsec-intf-cleanupunsigned int32
Time period to keep IPsec VPN interfaces up after WTP sessions are disconnected (30 - 3600 sec, default = 120).
radio-stats-intervalunsigned int32
Time between running radio reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 15).
rogue-ap-logunsigned int32
Time between logging rogue AP messages if periodic rogue AP logging is configured (0 - 1440 min, default = 0).
sta-capability-intervalunsigned int32
Time between running station capability reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 30).
sta-locate-timerunsigned int32
Time between running client presence flushes to remove clients that are listed but no longer present (0 - 86400 sec, default = 1800).
sta-stats-intervalunsigned int32
Time between running client (station) reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 1).
vap-stats-intervalunsigned int32
Time between running Virtual Access Point (VAP) reports (1 - 255 sec, default = 15).

_centmgmtoption
"disable"

"disable"[Default value]

"disable"[Default value]
"enable"
"ext"
access-control-listdatasource, refer to wireless-controller access-control-list (maximum 1)
access-control-list profile name.
address-groupdatasource, refer to wireless-controller addrgrp, or firewall addrgrp (maximum 1)
Address group ID.
aliasstring
Alias.
atf-weightunsigned int32
Airtime weight in percentage (default = 20).
authoption
Authentication protocol.
"radius"Use a RADIUS server to authenticate clients.
"usergroup"Use a firewall usergroup to authenticate clients.
"psk"Use a single Pre-shard Key (PSK) to authenticate all users.
broadcast-ssidoption
Enable/disable broadcasting the SSID (default = enable).
"disable"Disable broadcasting the SSID.
"enable"Enable broadcasting the SSID.
broadcast-suppressionflags
Optional suppression of broadcast messages. For example, you can keep DHCP messages, ARP broadcasts, and so on off of the wireless network.
"netbios-ns"Suppress NetBIOS name services packets with UDP port 137.
"netbios-ds"Suppress NetBIOS datagram services packets with UDP port 138.
"dhcp-up"Suppress broadcast uplink DHCP messages.
"dhcp-down"Suppress broadcast downlink DHCP messages.
"arp-known"Suppress broadcast ARP for known wireless clients.
"arp-unknown"Suppress broadcast ARP for unknown wireless clients.
"arp-reply"Suppress broadcast ARP reply from wireless clients.
"ipv6"Suppress IPv6 packets.
"dhcp-starvation"Suppress broadcast DHCP starvation req messages.
"arp-poison"Suppress ARP poison messages from wireless clients.
"all-other-mc"Suppress all other multicast messages.
"all-other-bc"Suppress all other broadcast messages.
"arp-proxy"Reply ARP requests for wireless clients as a proxy.
"dhcp-ucast"Convert downlink broadcast DHCP messages to unicast messages.
bss-color-partialoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax partial BSS color (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax partial BSS color.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax partial BSS color.
captive-portal-ac-namestring
Local-bridging captive portal ac-name.
captive-portal-auth-timeoutunsigned int32
Hard timeout - AP will always clear the session after timeout regardless of traffic (0 - 864000 sec, default = 0).
dhcp-lease-timeunsigned int32
DHCP lease time in seconds for NAT IP address.
dhcp-option43-insertionoption
Enable/disable insertion of DHCP option 43 (default = enable).
"disable"Disable insertion of DHCP option 43.
"enable"Enable insertion of DHCP option 43.
dhcp-option82-circuit-id-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 circuit-id insert.
"style-1"ASCII string composed of AP-MAC;SSID;SSID-TYPE. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx;wifi;s".
"style-2"ASCII string composed of AP-MAC. For example, "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
"style-3"ASCII string composed of NETWORK-TYPE:WTPPROF-NAME:VLAN:SSID:AP-MODEL:AP-HOSTNAME:AP-MAC. For example,"WLAN:FAPS221E-default:100:wifi:PS221E:FortiAP-S221E:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".
dhcp-option82-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 insert.
"enable"Enable DHCP option 82 insert.
dhcp-option82-remote-id-insertionoption
Enable/disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert (default = disable).
"disable"Disable DHCP option 82 remote-id insert.
"style-1"ASCII string in the format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx" containing MAC address of client device.
dynamic-vlanoption
Enable/disable dynamic VLAN assignment.
"disable"Disable dynamic VLAN assignment.
"enable"Enable dynamic VLAN assignment.
dynamic_mappingtable
eap-reauthoption
Enable/disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
"disable"Disable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
"enable"Enable EAP re-authentication for WPA-Enterprise security.
eap-reauth-intvunsigned int32
EAP re-authentication interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
eapol-key-retriesoption
Enable/disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2) (default = enable).
"disable"Disable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
"enable"Enable retransmission of EAPOL-Key frames (message 3/4 and group message 1/2).
encryptoption
Encryption protocol to use (only available when security is set to a WPA type).
"TKIP"Use TKIP encryption.
"AES"Use AES encryption.
"TKIP-AES"Use TKIP and AES encryption.
external-fast-roamingoption
Enable/disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs not managed by the FortiGate (default = disable).
"disable"Disable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
"enable"Enable fast roaming or pre-authentication with external APs.
external-logoutstring
URL of external authentication logout server.
external-webstring
URL of external authentication web server.
external-web-formatoption
URL query parameter detection (default = auto-detect).
"auto-detect"Automatically detect if "external-web" URL has any query parameter.
"no-query-string""external-web" URL does not have any query parameter.
"partial-query-string""external-web" URL has some query parameters.
fast-bss-transitionoption
Enable/disable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT).
"enable"Enable 802.11r Fast BSS Transition (FT).
fast-roamingoption
Enable/disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication, where supported by clients (default = disable).
"disable"Disable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication.
"enable"Enable fast-roaming, or pre-authentication.
ft-mobility-domainunsigned int32
Mobility domain identifier in FT (1 - 65535, default = 1000).
ft-over-dsoption
Enable/disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
"disable"Disable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
"enable"Enable FT over the Distribution System (DS).
ft-r0-key-lifetimeunsigned int32
Lifetime of the PMK-R0 key in FT, 1-65535 minutes.
gtk-rekeyoption
Enable/disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
"disable"Disable GTK rekey for WPA security.
"enable"Enable GTK rekey for WPA security.
gtk-rekey-intvunsigned int32
GTK rekey interval (1800 - 864000 sec, default = 86400).
high-efficiencyoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax high efficiency (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax high efficiency.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax high efficiency.
hotspot20-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller hotspot20 hs-profile (maximum 1)
Hotspot 2.0 profile name.
intra-vap-privacyoption
Enable/disable blocking communication between clients on the same SSID (called intra-SSID privacy) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable intra-SSID privacy.
"enable"Enable intra-SSID privacy.
ipIPv4 address/mask
IP address and subnet mask for the local standalone NAT subnet.
ipv6-rulesflags
Optional rules of IPv6 packets. For example, you can keep RA, RS and so on off of the wireless network.
"drop-icmp6ra"Drop ICMP6 Router Advertisement (RA) packets that originate from wireless clients.
"drop-icmp6rs"Drop ICMP6 Router Solicitation (RS) packets to be sent to wireless clients.
"drop-llmnr6"Drop Link-Local Multicast Name Resolution (LLMNR) packets
"drop-icmp6mld2"Drop ICMP6 Multicast Listener Report V2 (MLD2) packets
"drop-dhcp6s"Drop DHCP6 server generated packets that originate from wireless clients.
"drop-dhcp6c"Drop DHCP6 client generated packets to be sent to wireless clients.
"ndp-proxy"Enable IPv6 ndp proxy - send back na on behalf of the client and drop the ns.
"drop-ns-dad"Drop ICMP6 NS-DAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
"drop-ns-nondad"Drop ICMP6 NS-NonDAD when target address is not found in ndp proxy cache.
keypassword
WEP Key.
keyindexunsigned int32
WEP key index (1 - 4).
ldpcoption
VAP low-density parity-check (LDPC) coding configuration.
"disable"Disable LDPC.
"tx"Enable LDPC when transmitting traffic.
"rx"Enable LDPC when receiving traffic.
"rxtx"Enable LDPC when both receiving and transmitting traffic.
local-authenticationoption
Enable/disable AP local authentication.
"disable"Disable AP local authentication.
"enable"Enable AP local authentication.
local-bridgingoption
Enable/disable bridging of wireless and Ethernet interfaces on the FortiAP (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
"enable"Enable AP local VAP to Ethernet bridging.
local-lanoption
Allow/deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address (default = allow).
"deny"Deny traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
"allow"Allow traffic destined for a Class A, B, or C private IP address.
local-standaloneoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone (default = disable).
"disable"Disable AP local standalone.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone.
local-standalone-natoption
Enable/disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
"disable"Disable AP local standalone NAT mode.
"enable"Enable AP local standalone NAT mode.
mac-auth-bypassoption
Enable/disable MAC authentication bypass.
"disable"Disable MAC authentication bypass.
"enable"Enable MAC authentication bypass.
mac-filteroption
Enable/disable MAC filtering to block wireless clients by mac address.
"disable"Disable MAC filtering.
"enable"Enable MAC filtering.
mac-filter-listtable
mac-filter-policy-otheroption
Allow or block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
"deny"Block clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
"allow"Allow clients with MAC addresses that are not in the filter list.
max-clientsunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
max-clients-apunsigned int32
Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously to the VAP per AP radio (default = 0, meaning no limitation).
me-disable-threshunsigned int32
Disable multicast enhancement when this many clients are receiving multicast traffic.
mesh-backhauloption
Enable/disable using this VAP as a WiFi mesh backhaul (default = disable). This entry is only available when security is set to a WPA type or open.
"disable"Disable mesh backhaul.
"enable"Enable mesh backhaul.
mpskoption
"disable"
"enable"
mpsk-concurrent-clientsunsigned int32
mpsk-keytable
mpsk-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller mpsk-profile (maximum 1)
MPSK profile name.
mu-mimooption
Enable/disable Multi-user MIMO (default = enable).
"disable"Disable Multi-user MIMO.
"enable"Enable Multi-user MIMO.
multicast-enhanceoption
Enable/disable converting multicast to unicast to improve performance (default = disable).
"disable"Disable multicast enhancement.
"enable"Enable multicast enhancement.
multicast-rateoption
Multicast rate (0, 6000, 12000, or 24000 kbps, default = 0).
"0"Use the default multicast rate.
"6000"6 Mbps.
"12000"12 Mbps.
"24000"24 Mbps.
namestring, master key
Virtual AP name.
okcoption
Enable/disable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC) (default = enable).
"disable"Disable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC).
"enable"Enable Opportunistic Key Caching (OKC).
owe-groupsflags
OWE-Groups.
"19"DH Group 19.
"20"DH Group 20.
"21"DH Group 21.
owe-transitionoption
Enable/disable OWE transition mode support.
"disable"Disable OWE transition mode support.
"enable"Enable OWE transition mode support.
owe-transition-ssidstring
OWE transition mode peer SSID.
passphrasepassword
WPA pre-shared key (PSK) to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
pmfoption
Protected Management Frames (PMF) support (default = disable).
"disable"Disable PMF completely.
"enable"Enable PMF but deny clients without PMF.
"optional"Enable PMF and allow clients without PMF.
pmf-assoc-comeback-timeoutunsigned int32
Protected Management Frames (PMF) comeback maximum timeout (1-20 sec).
pmf-sa-query-retry-timeoutunsigned int32
Protected Management Frames (PMF) SA query retry timeout interval (1 - 5 100s of msec).
portal-message-override-groupdatasource, refer to system replacemsg-group (maximum 1)
Replacement message group for this VAP (only available when security is set to a captive portal type).
portal-message-overridesobject
portal-typeoption
Captive portal functionality. Configure how the captive portal authenticates users and whether it includes a disclaimer.
"auth"Portal for authentication.
"auth+disclaimer"Portal for authentication and disclaimer.
"disclaimer"Portal for disclaimer.
"email-collect"Portal for email collection.
"cmcc"Portal for CMCC.
"cmcc-macauth"Portal for CMCC and MAC authentication.
"auth-mac"Portal for authentication and MAC authentication.
"external-auth"Portal for external portal authentication.
primary-wag-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wag-profile (maximum 1)
Primary wireless access gateway profile name.
probe-resp-suppressionoption
Enable/disable probe response suppression (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable probe response suppression.
"enable"Enable probe response suppression.
probe-resp-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to probe requests (-95 to -20, default = -80).
ptk-rekeyoption
Enable/disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
"disable"Disable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.
"enable"Enable PTK rekey for WPA-Enterprise security.

quarantineoption
Enable/disable station quarantine (default = enable).
"disable"Disable station quarantine.
"enable"Enable station quarantine.
radio-2g-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 2.4G band (-95 to -20, default = -79).
radio-5g-thresholdstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP response to receive a packet in 5G band(-95 to -20, default = -76).
radio-sensitivityoption
Enable/disable software radio sensitivity (to ignore weak signals) (default = disable).
"disable"Disable software radio sensitivity.
"enable"Enable software radio sensitivity.
radius-mac-authoption
Enable/disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication of clients (default = disable).
"disable"Disable RADIUS-based MAC authentication.
"enable"Enable RADIUS-based MAC authentication.

radius-mac-auth-usergroupsstring array

radius-serverdatasource, refer to user radius (maximum 1)
RADIUS server to be used to authenticate WiFi users.

scheduledatasource, refer to firewall schedule group, firewall schedule onetime, or firewall schedule recurring (maximum 16)
Firewall schedules for enabling this VAP on the FortiAP. This VAP will be enabled when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
secondary-wag-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller wag-profile (maximum 1)
Secondary wireless access gateway profile name.
securityoption
Security mode for the wireless interface (default = wpa2-only-personal).
"wep64"WEP 64-bit.
"wep128"WEP 128-bit.
"open"Open.
"wpa-personal"WPA/WPA2 personal.
"wpa-enterprise"WPA/WPA2 enterprise.
"captive-portal"Captive portal.
"wpa-only-personal"WPA personal.
"wpa-only-enterprise"WPA enterprise.
"wpa2-only-personal"WPA2 personal.
"wpa2-only-enterprise"WPA2 enterprise.
"wpa-personal+captive-portal"WPA/WPA2 personal with captive portal.
"wpa-only-personal+captive-portal"WPA personal with captive portal.
"wpa2-only-personal+captive-portal"WPA2 personal with captive portal.
"osen"OSEN.
"wpa3-enterprise"WPA3 enterprise.
"owe"Opportunistic wireless encryption.
"wpa3-sae"WPA3 SAE.
"wpa3-sae-transition"WPA3 SAE transition.
security-exempt-listdatasource, refer to user security-exempt-list (maximum 1)
Optional security exempt list for captive portal authentication.
security-obsolete-optionoption
Enable/disable obsolete security options.
"disable"Disable obsolete security options (WPA only and WEP).
"enable"Enable obsolete security options (WPA only and WEP).
security-redirect-urlstring
Optional URL for redirecting users after they pass captive portal authentication.
selected-usergroupsdatasource, refer to user group
Selective user groups that are permitted to authenticate.
split-tunnelingoption
Enable/disable split tunneling (default = disable).
"disable"Disable split tunneling.
"enable"Enable split tunneling.
ssidstring
IEEE 802.11 service set identifier (SSID) for the wireless interface. Users who wish to use the wireless network must configure their computers to access this SSID name.
sticky-client-removeoption
Enable/disable sticky client remove to maintain good signal level clients in SSID. (default = disable).
"disable"Disable Sticky Client Remove.
"enable"Enable Sticky Client Remove.
sticky-client-threshold-2gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 2G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -79).
sticky-client-threshold-5gstring
Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the 5G client to be serviced by the AP (-95 to -20, default = -76).
target-wake-timeoption
Enable/disable 802.11ax target wake time (default = enable).
"disable"Disable 802.11ax target wake time.
"enable"Enable 802.11ax target wake time.
tkip-counter-measureoption
Enable/disable TKIP counter measure.
"disable"Disable TKIP counter measure.
"enable"Enable TKIP counter measure.
tunnel-echo-intervalunsigned int32
The time interval to send echo to both primary and secondary tunnel peers (1 - 65535 sec, default = 300).
tunnel-fallback-intervalunsigned int32
The time interval for secondary tunnel to fall back to primary tunnel (0 - 65535 sec, default = 7200).
usergroupdatasource, refer to user group
Firewall user group to be used to authenticate WiFi users.
utm-profiledatasource, refer to wireless-controller utm-profile (maximum 1)
UTM profile name.
vlan-autooption
Enable/disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
"disable"Disable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
"enable"Enable automatic management of SSID VLAN interface.
vlan-pooltable
vlan-poolingoption
Enable/disable VLAN pooling, to allow grouping of multiple wireless controller VLANs into VLAN pools (default = disable). When set to wtp-group, VLAN pooling occurs with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
"wtp-group"Enable VLAN pooling with VLAN assignment by wtp-group.
"round-robin"Enable VLAN pooling with round-robin VLAN assignment.
"hash"Enable VLAN pooling with hash-based VLAN assignment.
"disable"Disable VLAN pooling.
vlanidunsigned int32
Optional VLAN ID.
voice-enterpriseoption
Enable/disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming (default = disable).
"disable"Disable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming.
"enable"Enable 802.11k and 802.11v assisted Voice-Enterprise roaming.

 

wireless-controller/vap/dynamic_mapping (table)

Configure Virtual Access Points (VAPs).

Supported methods: get (table), get (object), add, set, update, delete, clone

Object URL:
Table/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/vap/<vap_name>/dynamic_mapping
Object/pm/config/device/<device_name>/vdom/<vdom_name>/wireless-controller/vap/<vap_name>/dynamic_mapping/<device_name>/<vdom_name>
Attribute ListDescriptions
80211koption
"disable"
"enable"
80211voption
"disable"
"enable"
_centmgmtoption
"disable"
"enable"[Default value]
_dhcp_svr_iddatasource, refer to sys_dhcp_svr id (maximum 1)
_intf_allowaccessflags
"https"
"ping"
"ssh"
"snmp"
"http"
"telnet"
"fgfm"
"radius-acct"
"probe-response"
"dnp"
"ftm"
"fabric"
"speed-test"
_intf_device-access-listdatasource, refer to user device-access-list (maximum 1)
_intf_device-identificationoption
"disable"[Default value]
"enable"
_intf_device-netscanoption
"disable"[Default value]
"enable"
_intf_dhcp-relay-ipIPv4 address array
_intf_dhcp-relay-serviceoption
"disable"[Default value]
"enable"
_intf_dhcp-relay-typeoption
"regular"[Default value]
"ipsec"
